story:
Hi! I am Andrei and here is Why I do what I do...

I volunteered for about a year and a half to help educate orphans and abandoned children in placement centers in Bucharest. About 3 months into my volunteering activities, I had the chance to work with this little girl by the name of Christina. She was only 6 at the time. On that day, we had decided we were all going to draw something, and at some point, the entire group agreed to draw hearts.

Christina immediately said "I don't want to draw because I am not good at it."

I replied "But, Chrissy, you haven't even tried."

"I can't draw hearts. I don't know how."

"Ok, we'll learn together."

She agreed, and for the next hour, I taught her step by step, how to draw a heart.

"First you draw half a circle. See? Very good! Now, a second one, next to the other. Now, let's draw an arrow head to bring their ends together."

She was still struggling, so I took her little hand and guided it so she would learn the motion. Then, I let her do it a few times. It wasn't perfect, but she managed to do it.

She was so excited and happy that she was able to draw a heart all by herself. I just couldn't believe how happy a child can be for something that, to many of us, seems like a mundane task.

And then came the problem...

She took the drawing to her caretaker in the placement center to show her what she had accomplished, and that caretaker immediately started to point out the flaws in her drawing. Little Chrissy was instantly discouraged. It broke my heart.

All that work and for nothing. Or so I thought. Actually, It wasn't for nothing, because in all that negativity, for a few moments little Chrissy tasted hope, fulfillment and joy. Unfortunately, there are thousands of kids just like Chrissy, so I want to give those kids many, many more such moments.

I believe that, if I manage to organise such workshops systematically, at least a few of those kids will be inspired more so than they are torn down, and instead of ending up on the streets when they turn eighteen, they might just find the strength to forge a new path for themselves. It's really up to us to tip this ballance. 

 

A few things about me

My name is Andrei Emanuel Pop, owner of Varahil Art, and I disregarded my calling as an artist for the past 12 years. Why? Because, being part of a large family, while my parents did all they could to support us and our dreams, some things just don't go as you would like in life. So, instead of pursuing arts or architecture as I would have wanted, I went to the military high school (which offered a state-funded boarding school program and a good education), then military academy (same system) and then served for the past 3 years. Now, however, it is time to do that which I was built to do: inspire you through the gifts I was given.

As an artist, I work primarily in Adobe Illustrator, but, if this campaign is a success, I will have the time and resources to start learning how to use Adobe Photoshop professionally as well.

In terms of business skills, I have been involved in a small training and consultancy business for the past 2 years. It was and is my first business and has been quite the journey so far. Additionally, in the fall of 2017 I partook in a 12 week start-up development course, in order to gain even more clarity in what concerns starting a successful business.

So, could I go on this journey alone? Yes. Would it be harder without your help? Definitely Yes. However, whether I can or cannot do this alone is not the point of this campaign. This journey is about the people in it and what we can achieve together. To some it may sound naive, but I have a vision of a world in which people from all corners of the world make contributions, big and small, to bring about great change. A world in which we truly care about and support each other irrespective of gender, religion or race. So, this campaign also comes as a first step towards achieving this vision.

What I have accomplished thus far

Before deciding to initiate this campaign, I had a few small victories. Here is what I was able to achieve up until now:

  • Built an initial portfolio, which you can find on my facebook page - Varahil Art. 
  • Opened a personal store on Society6, that uses my creations and that you can find here. 
  • Managed to get my first bigger gig as a creative - drew 26 graphics for the manual of a lifeguard training center (to be published);
  • Did an array of smaller jobs like tattoo designs, logo designs, training certificate designs, graphics for military badges and so on;

What I am working on currently

I am currently involved in the following activities:

  • About to finish a 30 day Art challenge, by December 1st, in order to train my creative muscles and my commitment to this life-changing mission;
  • Still working on my personal website called 'Varahil Art'. I will let you know here in an update once that is up and running, so you can see my portfolio and services in a much neater fashion;
  • Started working on the online store for the inspiration art hub. We (as in, my partner, Raluca, and I) will most likely launch it in January 2019. You can sign up here to get the email when we are officially open. The store will be initially open for the Romanian market and only later, once our processes are all squared away, will we open a store for international sales (hopefully by the end of the year). However, our services will be available internationally, so that is a plus. Below you can see the logo of the store (also created by yours truly): 

 

Help me by allowing me to help You

-The goals-

I need an initial total of $5000. Here is how the $5000 dollars from the campaign will be spent:

  • $3000 will go into 4 months' worth of sustenance - this will allow me to build a strong portfolio as I serve you all for all your pre-orders, and build a pertinent personal brand as an artist. Most importantly, it will offer me the much needed peace of mind that will help me focus completely on creating awesome art to inspire you. Or entertain you. Or both at the same time.
  • The other $2000 will go into the setup and initial marketing efforts of the online store that will start the inspiration art hub concept, so we can create a long term source of income to support the management and organization of the creative workshops for kids. In order to organize the workshops, we will collaborate with the NGO at which I volunteered, because their team has great situational awareness and can tell us which of the kids would benefit the most from this kind of support.

If the campaign goes beyond the $5000 goal, I will be splitting the money between supporting myself and supporting the operational and marketing costs of the hub, to jump start it and make it international faster. However, if all goes as planned, I will not need any money past the initial $3000 for personal use, because I should have built a decent personal brand and client base by then, so all the extra funds will go into supporting the growth of the online store.

Should the campaign goal not be reached, everything below the first $3000 will go into sustenance. Anything past the $3000 will go into the hub. This is because I will be able to get other projects easier if I have peace of mind and thus, make the rest of the money to support the hub via projects outside the ones dedicated to the backers of this campaign.

-The perks-

Depending on your choices, I can offer you any of the perks present in this campaign. Also, if there is something you had in mind other than what I am offering here, let me know in an email, we will discuss pricing and you can then buy the equivalent perk from the campaign.

I will start offering the services once the campaign ends, on a first-come-first-served basis, and, hopefully, I will have accomplished all of them by the end of August 2019, at the latest. Generally, for perks such as logo, certificate and letter designs, I will be creating 3 initial concepts and you will have 2 revision sessions for each perk. Anything past that will involve an additional fee equal to 20% of the base price for the perk. As such, good communication will be of utmost importance.

As far as the physical product perks are concerned, our intent is to have you get those just in time for the next holiday season. I say "our" because I have a team with which I am working on developing the hub.

 

Risks & Challenges

While my goal is to fulfill all the services by the end of August 2019, I find it more important that each of you receive an artistic work that truly inspires and satisfies you. On this note, I will ask that you be patient with me if, by some chance, I do not succeed in meeting this deadline. I don't think that will be the case though, since, so far at least, I have been able to finish all my graphic design projects ahead of schedule, but a word of warning never hurts.

As far as the online store is concerned, developing the infrastructure for this business has proven to be quite a challenge. I am certain it will be a success in time, but, if by some chance we will not meet our intended deadlines, I will contact each backer to discuss win-win solutions. My partner, as well as our collaborators for production and marketing are really good at what they do though, so I am fairly confident in our ability to meet our goal of delivering the products just in time for your next holiday season.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Here are some things you can do if you can't help as a backer:

1) Tell at least 3 friends who might be interested in these products and services;

2) If you already own an online store and want to help me get an edge in this industry, I would be happy to seek your counsel;

3) Share this campaign on your social media accounts via the share buttons. The more people hear about this, the better the chance of meeting our goals!

Again, thank you so much for taking the time to read these lines and for your support! It means a lot to me and I will make sure to make it mean a whole lot more to a whole lot of other people.

I look forward to serving you!

story:
Vi vil åbne en Salon.

Ikke en frisør, men en salon med kunst!

 

Der findes så meget fedt kunst i verdenen. Det ses dog, at kulturen, i dag, ofte er rettet mod en bestemt genre og platformene er typisk bestemt af de mere veletablerede udstillere, eller kunstnere, der har netværket til at kunne bryde igennem. 

Det er her vi vil gøre en forskel!

Vi vil støtte op om alle de kunstnere som ikke selv har netværket, økonomien eller redskaberne til at blive set og hørt! 

=====================================================

Gennem vores, nu 3 års, erfaringer med afvikling af hhv. pop-up udstillinger, kortfilmsprojekter og kunstfestivaler, har vi gang på gang oplevet behovet for en større repræsentation af nutidens kunst, som tilmed vil være let tilgængelig for beskueren, såvel som for kunstneren. 

Derfor vil vi nu samle al vores erfaring i ét sted - Salon Monday... 

Vi skaber et hybridgalleri til udstilling af kunsten, i alle dens afskygninger. En kreativ, intim og inspirerende boble, lokaliseret i København. Her er enhver velkommen til, helt uformelt og helt gratis, at komme ind og fordybe sig i kunsten. En multidisciplinær kunst- & kulturbar, hvor kunstnerne kan udstille, fortælle, optræde og, generelt set, få en platform,

der kan moduleres til netop deres kunst.

 

Hvorfor støtte vores kampagne? 

Vi er godt på vej i hele processen med at åbne denne Salon, men vi mangler stadig din hjælp til at komme helt i mål. Hver en krone (€) vi kan samle ind i støtte her, skal vi ikke låne til i banken. Så vi håber du har lyst til at bidrage til vores projekt, ved at købe én af vores perks. Vi garanterer, at de kommer mangefold igen. Men det kræver selvfølgelig, at vi når 100% finansiering inden kampagnens udløb.

 

Støtter du vores Indiegogo er du med til at finansiere: 

Indskuddet på lokalerne. 

Byggematerialer til stole, borde - disse er færdigudviklede og klar til produktion. 

Sceneudstyr til koncerter, talks og andre spændende events. 

Og lys - så du kan se hvad, der egentlig sker! 

 

P.S. Kan du li' vores idé? Så vil vi være super taknemmelig, hvis du vil dele dette opslag med dine venner på Facebook eller Twitter.

 

 

Hvad er Salon Monday?

 

 

Vores Lokale Kreative Helte...! 

Vi har allieret os med 10 lokale kunstnere, vores såkaldte lokale kreative helte, der alle har støttet op om vores projekt, ved at donere deres værker til kampagnen.

Ved at støtte vores kickstarter kan du derfor få fingrene i værker fra: 

 

=====================================================

 

Vores Perks.. 

=====================================================

=====================================================

=====================================================

=====================================================

=====================================================

=====================================================

=====================================================

=====================================================

=====================================================

=====================================================

=====================================================

Hvordan får jeg min perk?

Når kampagnen er fuldt finansieret (100% eller mere), sender vi information til den email, du har brugt ved købet med en dato for hvornår, din perk er ses at være nået frem, med posten.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Vin Tabone, Managing Director of VJT Productions, LLC.   VJT was formed to produce films that are educational, inspirational, and healing.  I am also the Producer of the PBS documentary: The Hudson River School: Artistic Pioneers (Part 1).  Prior to film-making I was Director of Licensing for Sony Music in New York.  After many years at Sony I turned the next chapter to something familiar and dear to my heart, something that still inspires me today and causes me to stop, focus, and tune out the rest of the world - the artists and artwork of The Hudson River School.  These artists provide a varied, and colorful commentary on 19th century life, and the challenges that encompassed its time.   Like many of us they were concerned about the world they lived in, the environment, their country, the future, religion, and the direction of an America they valued deeply.  They conveyed their thoughts, opinions, and creative expression the only way they knew how - through their brilliant artwork.  Majestic mountains, rugged wilderness, clear running streams, bucolic landscapes, mighty rivers, jungles and icebergs, these all had an impact on the men of The Hudson River School.  They also spoke of conservation, preservation, protection of our natural resources, and held a religious reverence for the land.  The resulting artwork would form a unique national identity that would fill museums around the world.  This series is a journey - and I'd love for you to come along so we can take this journey together!  By contributing you'll be keeping their story, and the mission behind their message alive.  By contributing you'll also be supporting art education...here's one way how:  PBS Distribution will make this film digitally available to high school classrooms, colleges and universities through their PBS Learning Media Program.  Millions of students will benefit intellectually and emotionally by this program.  By contributing you will also be providing relief to millions who are in desperate need of repose from the constant bombardment of today's negative, fear-filled media.  A film like The Hudson River School will take the viewer away from all of that.  Cultivating a Tradition will be 53 minutes of peaceful, soothing landscapes, beautiful vistas, calming scenes, and illustrious beams of luminous sunlight.  The message here is positive, thought-provoking, reflective, and spiritually and emotionally uplifting.  Something we all need right now.  

We have had generous contributors - but we still need a total of $15,000 to get the production of the Hudson River School Part 2 off the ground.   This money will go toward legal fees, insurance costs, licensing fees, equipment rentals, voice-over talent, and filming and editing production costs.   If we don't reach our goal all money will be refunded to those generous individuals and organizations that contributed. 

Our perks include an autographed DVD of the documentary by the producer, postcards of the movie promo image which contains Sanford Gifford's, "A Gorge in the Mountains," a special thanks in the film credits, a 11 X 17 inch autographed poster (suitable for framing and depicting the DVD cover - see above images) of the beautiful movie promo image of "A Gorge in the Mountains," even dinner in the Hudson River Valley or New York City area with the producer! 

The Impact of The Hudson River School series has been impressive, and our PBS television distributor and PBS Distribution have both committed, in writing, to distribute Part 2 when it is completed.  A need exists for this kind of programming.  This amounts to millions of viewers and consumers nationwide who will enjoy this film.  The documentary will make its way to museum gift shops (like the one at The National Gallery in Washington, where Artistic Pioneers recently sold out), major libraries like The New York Public Library, Amazon.com, Best Buy, Barnes & Noble, Netflix, shoppbs.org, and youtube..their reach is vast so many can enjoy this production! 

The challenge we face to reach our goal is real, there are many worthy causes that need funding, but the reward for contributing - whatever you can give - is great!  Supporting the arts and the inspiring story of our indigenous culture is invaluable.  This is something worth fighting for so we all can continue to learn, grow, and become culturally enlightened about the world we live in.  We overcame many obstacles producing, Part 1 "Artistic Pioneers," but, at the end of the day The Metropolitan Museum of Art joined the fight and helped, as did The New-York Historical Society and many other major foundations and organizations such as the Thomas Cole National Historic Site.  And many of these organizations are already on board for Part 2, like The Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Wadsworth Atheneum, The Thomas Cole National Historic Site, The Newington-Cropsey Foundation, The Gladys Kreible Delmas Foundation, and many others.   It's also worth fighting for because art education benefits our future generations greatly.  Here's how:  

According to a report by Americans for the Arts…    

- Art education strengthens problem-solving, decision making and critical-thinking skills..

- Art education raises SAT scores..

- Studies show that there is a correlation between art and other achievements..such as..

- Young people who participate regularly in the arts are 4 times more likely to be recognized for academic achievement..

- Art education teaches students how to interpret, criticize, use visual information, and how to make choices based on it..

Another valuable asset VJT Productions has for Part 2 is its wonderful videographer, Paul Frederick.  Paul is an experienced, creative artist in his own right, and he has worked on several wonderful PBS Productions..such as "Frederic Church's Olana: An American Treasure."  Please go here to see a sample of his beautiful work:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GYlE2evtWHU

Please keep something in mind, even if you cannot contribute financially to "Cultivating a Tradition" we can still use your help to get the word out about this important series.  You can do this by using the Indiegogo share tools to tell all your friends and family...and thank you for that!  

And thank you, especially, for any financial help you can give this documentary, and for taking the time to be a part of this one-of-a-kind, educational program!  

Vin
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Vin Tabone, Managing Director of VJT Productions, LLC.   VJT was formed to produce films that are educational, inspirational, and healing.  I am also the Producer of the PBS documentary: The Hudson River School: Artistic Pioneers (Part 1).  Prior to film-making I was Director of Licensing for Sony Music in New York.  After many years at Sony I turned the next chapter to something familiar and dear to my heart, something that still inspires me today and causes me to stop, focus, and tune out the rest of the world - the artists and artwork of The Hudson River School.  These artists provide a varied, and colorful commentary on 19th century life, and the challenges that encompassed its time.   Like many of us they were concerned about the world they lived in, the environment, their country, the future, religion, and the direction of an America they valued deeply.  They conveyed their thoughts, opinions, and creative expression the only way they knew how - through their brilliant artwork.  Majestic mountains, rugged wilderness, clear running streams, bucolic landscapes, mighty rivers, jungles and icebergs, these all had an impact on the men of The Hudson River School.  They also spoke of conservation, preservation, protection of our natural resources, and held a religious reverence for the land.  The resulting artwork would form a unique national identity that would fill museums around the world.  This series is a journey - and I'd love for you to come along so we can take this journey together!  By contributing you'll be keeping their story, and the mission behind their message alive.  By contributing you'll also be supporting art education...here's one way how:  PBS Distribution will make this film digitally available to high school classrooms, colleges and universities through their PBS Learning Media Program.  Millions of students will benefit intellectually and emotionally by this program.  By contributing you will also be providing relief to millions who are in desperate need of repose from the constant bombardment of today's negative, fear-filled media.  A film like The Hudson River School will take the viewer away from all of that.  Cultivating a Tradition will be 53 minutes of peaceful, soothing landscapes, beautiful vistas, calming scenes, and illustrious beams of luminous sunlight.  The message here is positive, thought-provoking, reflective, and spiritually and emotionally uplifting.  Something we all need right now.  
We have had generous contributors - but we still need a total of $15,000 to get the production of the Hudson River School Part 2 off the ground.   This money will go toward legal fees, insurance costs, licensing fees, equipment rentals, voice-over talent, and filming and editing production costs.   If we don't reach our goal all money will be refunded to those generous individuals and organizations that contributed. 
Our perks include an autographed DVD of the documentary by the producer, postcards of the movie promo image which contains Sanford Gifford's, "A Gorge in the Mountains," a special thanks in the film credits, a 11 X 17 inch autographed poster (suitable for framing and depicting the DVD cover - see above images) of the beautiful movie promo image of "A Gorge in the Mountains," even dinner in the Hudson River Valley or New York City area with the producer! 
The Impact of The Hudson River School series has been impressive, and our PBS television distributor and PBS Distribution have both committed, in writing, to distribute Part 2 when it is completed.  A need exists for this kind of programming.  This amounts to millions of viewers and consumers nationwide who will enjoy this film.  The documentary will make its way to museum gift shops (like the one at The National Gallery in Washington, where Artistic Pioneers recently sold out), major libraries like The New York Public Library, Amazon.com, Best Buy, Barnes & Noble, Netflix, shoppbs.org, and youtube..their reach is vast so many can enjoy this production! 

The challenge we face to reach our goal is real, there are many worthy causes that need funding, but the reward for contributing - whatever you can give - is great!  Supporting the arts and the inspiring story of our indigenous culture is invaluable.  This is something worth fighting for so we all can continue to learn, grow, and become culturally enlightened about the world we live in.  We overcame many obstacles producing, Part 1 "Artistic Pioneers," but, at the end of the day The Metropolitan Museum of Art joined the fight and helped, as did The New-York Historical Society and many other major foundations and organizations such as the Thomas Cole National Historic Site.  And many of these organizations are already on board for Part 2, like The Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Wadsworth Atheneum, The Thomas Cole National Historic Site, The Newington-Cropsey Foundation, The Gladys Kreible Delmas Foundation, and many others.   It's also worth fighting for because art education benefits our future generations greatly.  Here's how:  
According to a report by Americans for the Arts…    
- Art education strengthens problem-solving, decision making and critical-thinking skills..
- Art education raises SAT scores..
- Studies show that there is a correlation between art and other achievements..such as..
- Young people who participate regularly in the arts are 4 times more likely to be recognized for academic achievement..
- Art education teaches students how to interpret, criticize, use visual information, and how to make choices based on it..
Another valuable asset VJT Productions has for Part 2 is its wonderful videographer, Paul Frederick.  Paul is an experienced, creative artist in his own right, and he has worked on several wonderful PBS Productions..such as "Frederic Church's Olana: An American Treasure."  Please go here to see a sample of his beautiful work:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GYlE2evtWHU
Please keep something in mind, even if you cannot contribute financially to "Cultivating a Tradition" we can still use your help to get the word out about this important series.  You can do this by using the Indiegogo share tools to tell all your friends and family...and thank you for that!  
And thank you, especially, for any financial help you can give this documentary, and for taking the time to be a part of this one-of-a-kind, educational program!  
Vin

story:
PinkPain Tarot

One of the main intention to create PinkPain Tarot was to build a bridge between classical tarot symbolism and the visual language of millenials to show the mutual root that hides behind any idea of "ancient" and "modern" , "old" and "young", "traditional" and "cutting edge". Interpreting underground culture of the youth and mainstream  mythology, we blended elements of those domains in order to represent inheritance of the occult archetypes that cover themselve with the chameleonic mask. Developing the old idea of ancient mystics, we look at it as at the approach to enter the Concsciousness of the Generation and be pulled in the circle of the permanent rejuvination.   

Major Arcana

 

Minor Arcana

Divination Book


Tarot will also have a Divination Book in a Comic Book format that will help you understand the aesthetics of the magic of this deck. The book will be useful for professionals and amateurs.

What to Expect?

 

This is a pre-order campaign! We haven’t printed the decks yet—that’s why we’re raising funds on Indiegogo.

The amount that you backed will reserve you a copy of the deck, once it’s printed. 

At the end of this  2 month-long campaign, Indiegogo will send us all the funds we’ve raised. We’ll use that to print the finished decks in whatever quantities we end up needing. 

It’ll take about a month to print the decks, and then another month to transport them from the factory to our warehouse.

Then, once we receive the decks, we’ll ship your own copy! 

We anticipate this whole process (campaign, printing, shipping, and final deliveries of everyone’s order) will take around four months. 

We will post project updates along the way to keep you informed of the progress!

If you have any specific questions about the project, you can feel free to send us a message via Indiegogo’s messaging system, or email info@darksynevyr.com.

 

Risks and challenges

 

THIS IS OUR 4th CAMPAIGN AFTER 3 SUCCESSFUL. AND WE ARE SO IN LOVE WITH THIS DECK THAT WE WILL PUBLISH IT EVEN IF WE DON'T GET THE REQUIRED AMOUNT AND RETURN ALL MONEY. THIS COMPANY IS ALL OR NOTHING.

List of our Indiegogo Campaigns:

1. Tarot of Unknown Shadows

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/tarot-of-unk...

2. The Manuscript of Initiation Tarot

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-manuscri...

3. Paracelsus' Dreams Tarot

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/paracelsus-d...

story:
Short Summary

The NORM Arts Collective, designed by NORM Enterprise is a network of artists, producers, songwriters, videographers, and other talented individuals from Ottawa’s diverse art community founded in 2016. We aim to provide a platform for both established and upcoming artists to produce and showcase their talents through collaboration and mentorship within our collective. We intend to accomplish our goals with the introduction of “The Ingenuity project”.

"Ingenuity: the quality of being inventive and original."

Some highlights from NORM’s 5-year history have been our 8 musical showcase events which featured artists from within our collective and supported a charity run by one of our own members to support orphanages, schools, and hospitals in Port-au-Prince, Haiti. Additionally, NORM has provided services and networking to produce more than 20 single releases and 5 albums for our various artists.

NORM is continuously expanding and we are doing this by introducing our very own Merchandise Store called “Inner Peace Clothing” which caters to spiritual and mental wellness hoping to create a positive atmosphere in our community.

Why is this campaign important to us?

The campaign is crucial to us because it will help us tackle our objectives in different levels presented as follows.

 

Community: We are looking to build a strong foundation of Arts in our community, looking to promote local talents and set a positive trend in the mainstream media. We cater to artists from every background including people of colour, people with special needs and the LGBTQ community.

Mentorship: providing artist-to artist learning opportunities in production, songwriting, photography and videography, etc. We are looking to provide learning and mentoring opportunities for the upcoming local artist within our community who could use a helping hand to guide them as they progress on their artistic journey.

Charity: We are looking to partner with local charity organizations to ensure mental wellness, help provide food and clothing to homeless shelters and create an environment of hope by initiating programs that would create an opportunity for the homeless to earn a living and have a stable and continuous income. 

Inner Peace Clothing: We are looking to start and grow our very merch store called “Inner Peace Clothing” which caters to spiritual and mental wellness. We intend to do this by continuously evolving artistically, coming up with creative designs that are appealing to the public, and catering to the needs of our society in order to generate passive income for our company which will be invested back into our programs to help our community.

  • Your contribution would help us immensely in our pursuit to create a stronger and more connected artistic community in Ottawa. This will include helping us to:
  • Hold bigger and better showcases raising awareness for both our collective and the causes that we support.
  • Launch of our upcoming merchandise line and shop.
  • Continue to provide a platform and support to our collective members, bringing business to Ottawa’s artistic service providers and music-adjacent professionals.
  • Continue to support charitable causes close to our members’ hearts, as well as other members of our community.
  • Give a platform to members of our community to produce and release their unique work.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Funding

We are asking for the sum of $65,000 (CAD), which will be invested in:

  • Buying musical equipment and improving our current inventory of gears, supporting local artists in studio production, live performances, and authentic music visuals.
  • Buying photography and cinematography equipment to cater to the artistic needs of our community.
  • Investing in artistic programs to help promote local talents and set them up on a successful route.
  • Partnering with local and international businesses to shed more light on our community.
  • Partnering with media and marketing experts to grow our collective to a point where it’s financially self-reliant.
  • Growing our merchandise store with the latest trends while maintaining the NORM message so we can be more influential and effective.
  • Hosting mentorship workshops featuring established local artists to provide guidance to younger artists.
  • Supporting the releases of artists in our collective.
  • Expansion in order to take our creative talents to other cities via tours.
  • Creating a bedrock of hope in our community by continuously partnering with local charities.

We have a detailed Business Plan that contains an in-depth report on us, our needs, our goals and what we intend to accomplish which can be made available to contributors and investors upon request.

We are a collective made up of an extremely diverse community! Our membership is largely made up of individuals of colour, and we provide a space for people to share their unique cultural influences and experiences with one another. 

A unique feature of our collective is that through inter-artist collaboration, we have created opportunities for mentorship and education for our artists. If an artist intends to engage in self-improvement and skill-building programs, we offer them support in pursuing their passions.

 Finally, a major success within our collective has been the creation of a registered charity by one of our members — Umoja, which supports orphanages, schools, and hospitals in Port-au-Prince, Haiti. We have been able to give their charity a platform for fundraising through our showcase events. 

Given that the COVID-19 pandemic has impacted artists all over the world, and their ability to succeed during this especially trying time, we intend to direct any funds received to the most effective and appropriate projects that our artists can engage with while we remain on lockdown. This means that we will be prioritizing the production of musical releases over showcase planning, as well as investing in our upcoming merchandise line and store in order to be more financially independent and to generate passive income.

 

The Impact

  • Make contributions to local charities
  • Support marginalized communities that deserve a larger platform.
  • Raise cultural awareness and education
  • Invest in mentorship/education
  • Encourage collaboration
  • Generate business that supports a local economy of artists

Some highlights from NORM’s history includes: 8 showcase events, featuring artists from within our collective and supporting a charity run by one of our own members to support orphanages, schools, and hospitals in Port-au-Prince, Haiti. Additionally, NORM has provided services and networking in order to produce more than 20 single releases and 5 albums for our various artists.

Membership growth: At NORM we are solely dedicated to the growth and development of our members by establishing a venue of comfort and trust amongst members. Assisting members in areas of concern such as songwriting, music production, recording, performance, post-production etc. We started with a single founding member and are now a tight-knife community of 10 committed members alongside our casual contributors. We contributed $300 to “Gift of Giving” from the amount we raised from the show. We are looking to donate on a big scale so we’ll be donating 30% of the proceeds from our “Inner Peace Clothing” Store will be donated to charitable causes.

NORM CASE STUDY

As a specific case study for our members’ success: Our very own Gamou Diop started her membership with NORM as a singer/songwriter in 2017. She has since been featured in 4 NORM showcase events to help market her immense talent, and with our support has been able to release 5 fully produced singles and 3 music videos through our network. This has allowed her to grow her online presence and increase her exposure as an artist in the Ottawa community. We have been enormously proud of her success, and can’t wait to help her go even further!

We are an established collective with a 5-year history that has been able to consistently grow both our membership and our community engagement year by year. We intend to keep this trend going for the next 5 years and beyond. Our primary values are in giving support to people who need it, improving access to mentorship, and creating beautiful music with our members. Our commitment to continually contribute to charitable causes is one of the many driving forces behind our initiatives to improve.

 

Risks & Challenges

There have been points at which our co-founders have had to pay out-of-pocket for event expenses in order to maintain the metric of quality that they are passionate about delivering. This commitment to putting on an excellent show and providing a great experience for our artists is admirable, but we have also acknowledged it as not the most sustainable practice.

To help avoid these instances in the future, we established planning committees to review each event held and evaluate how it could be improved in terms of quality, efficiency, and value. This process has allowed us to reduce risk when planning our shows, and also create a forward-thinking system for continuous improvement as a collective. Furthermore, we have recognized the importance of becoming more financially independent of our showcase events for revenue, and plan to generate income for the collective through a merchandise line and online shop. Finally, we have also taken advantage of our growing network in order to open up offering artistic services such as photography and videography in the national capital region.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Your help in promoting our artists’ projects, our upcoming merchandise line and online store, as well as the charitable causes close to our hearts would make all the difference to us!

story:
Short Summary

     I'm Mykelle. I'm an artist and aerial performer that has started an aerial arts program in Twin Falls, Idaho. 
     I have been performing aerial arts for one year this summer. As an ex-competitive gymnast it has always been my dream to fly, and I found aerial silks to keep that dream alive. I knew that this community would love to have an outlet for this type of exercise so I partnered with my gym growing up and started a program this past January. 
     So far we have offered classes to over 50 people of all ages and fitness levels. There has always been an astounding "we loved it!" as people exited the studio.

    Which brings me to my point; I have been accepted to go to the best aerial intensive in the country for three weeks this summer. I want to learn as much as possible and bring back that knowledge and expertise to Twin Falls to continue to let the aerial program here grow.

What We Need & What You Get

In total I need to come up with $1,300 in the next 15 days to cover two expenses:

  • The round-trip air travel; $550
  • The deposit to hold my spot: $750 
In repayment I am offering the following services as perks of supporting me:
  • $15 Donation: A drop-in to one of my regularly scheduled classes at MVG
  • $50 Donation: 1 Hour Private on aerial apparatus of choice (Silks, Lyra, Hammock)
  • $100 Donation: 1 session Photo Shoot of your choice, whatever you want, up to two hours of shooting, includes edited images
  • $150 Donation: 2 Hour Aerial Workshop for a group of up to six(6) people  (Silks, Lyra, Hammock)
  • $250 Donation: I will perform an aerial routine of your choosing (Silks, Lyra, Hammock) at your next event. (Provided we can find rig)
     If I do not meet my entire goal I will use the money to go towards a the deposit for the intensive. 

The Impact

     Being able to bring aerial and circus arts to the Magic Valley is an honor I love to have. I personally love to go out and get more training to be able to train more here.      Teenagers and adults alike can partake in the Magic Valley for a fun way to get in shape as well as nights out watching aerial performers, which adds to the culture of our community. 

Risks & Challenges

     My risks are often physical in this line of work, for obvious reasons. But beyond that I see a challenge of trying to remember everything! 
     I plan to document as much as I can of what I learn so that nothing is lost in translation from Vermont to Twin Falls. 
     Also being able to connect with other circus artists and maybe bring them in for workshops and performances in the future would be a challenge I would love to take on. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help out financially to this there are other ways to help: :)

  • Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign by sharing on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

$50 Donation: 1 Hour Private on aerial apparatus of choice (Silks, Lyra, Hammock)
$100 Donation: 1 session Photo Shoot of your choice, whatever you want, up to two hours of shooting, includes edited images
$150 Donation: 2 Hour Aerial Workshop for a group of up to six(6) people  (Silks, Lyra, Hammock)
$250 Donation: I will perform an aerial routine of your choosing (Silks, Lyra, Hammock) at your next event. (Provided we can find rig)
     If I do not meet my entire goal I will use the money to go towards a the deposit for the intensive. 
The Impact      Being able to bring aerial and circus arts to the Magic Valley is an honor I love to have. I personally love to go out and get more training to be able to train more here.      Teenagers and adults alike can partake in the Magic Valley for a fun way to get in shape as well as nights out watching aerial performers, which adds to the culture of our community. 
    Risks & Challenges      My risks are often physical in this line of work, for obvious reasons. But beyond that I see a challenge of trying to remember everything!      I plan to document as much as I can of what I learn so that nothing is lost in translation from Vermont to Twin Falls.      Also being able to connect with other circus artists and maybe bring them in for workshops and performances in the future would be a challenge I would love to take on. 
    Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot help out financially to this there are other ways to help: :)  Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign by sharing on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter! Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
BEDTIME = ADVENTURE TIME

Gordon is a 9-year-old boy that loves bedtime. He loves when his mom reads to him because every night when he sleeps he enters into the dream portal with Pete to come out on the other side into an adventure. What's ahead is comedy, action and ice cream.

Join me on my adventure as I write and illustrate your next favorite children’s book for all ages. You'll love just as much as your kids and they'll want you to read to them over and over.

Spread the Word

  • Share the campaign and get people involved in this great journey
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Raising funds to manufacture and distribute the Penelope Baby doll.

Penelope is an adorable and charming book series released November 2019. These gorgeous and colorful books are for children everywhere. The Penelope book series also features Christopher and Timmy, who are always up to a bit of mischievous fun. The Penelope Books are meant to highlight family, gardening, staying active, and other great values important to shaping young developing minds!  But most importantly, the Penelope books are beautiful and lots of fun! We are so excited about this project.  Your funding will help manufacture our dolls, any donation of any amount is welcome.  (See below for more)

 

About the Project: 

  • We are raising $25,000+ to design, produce, and manufacture the dolls. 
  • We are so excited about this project and I can't wait for little girls and boys to hug their Penelope dolls as they fall asleep. We plan to launch dolls for Christopher and Timmy.
  • If our goal is reached, our backers will not only get an honorable mention as a backer, but also a Penelope doll or a signed copy of a Penelope book along with a cute Penelope bag. 
  •  If the goal is not reached we will continue to make other products and books with the funds we raise from this project. Currently, we will have Penelope bags for children to carry their books.

The Impact

Penelope is a positive little girl with a positive message of being healthy, active, and most importantly, spending time with family, enjoying childhood and not spending so much time on electronic devices or television. Wholesome and enjoyable books that children love. 

Buy Penelope Helps Mom and Dad here: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07ZWP9V3Whttps://www...

Buy Penelope Super Duper Spectacular Princess Ballerina here: https://www.amazon.com/Penelope-Super-Spectacul... 

Please support the Penelope Book Series. 

Penelope Helps Mom and Dad and Penelope Super Duper Spectacular Princess Ballerina is on sale now. 

Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/WorldPenelope

story:
Short Summary

In most cases contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to know about the campaign and the people involved:

  • Producer “Young Fresh Of Book Smart” and Musician “Jessie E.McGriff” started the Book Smart Records LLC In early 2019 and later singer “Jake Ryan” joined the team as a member.
  • The Road To Glory campaign is about utilizing the support of the public to elevate a standard LLC to not only an innovative platform, but a massive and creative empire.

What We Need & What You Get

  • What we need: we need your support and help in raising $2,500 to build the business, social, and creative sector of the business.
  • What you get: everyone who donates gets to receive an opportunity to be an official member of the company and the financial, social and personal benefits that comes with such. All that is required is once the campaign has reached the deadline, every contributor who donated sends an email with proof of donation to booksmartrecords@gmail.com and following that, instruction will be given on how to obtain legal membership of the business.
  • If by chance we don't reach the  entire goal at the end of the campaign, the funds raised  will go towards building  the company and expanding membership to supporters.

The Impact

Below I will explain more about our campaign and let everyone  know the difference their contribution will make:

  • This project is more than a fundraiser, it’s an experience that allows people to be a part of change , in music, business, entertainment, art, etc....
  • Imagine a social climate where it becomes intriguing to see young entrepreneurs receive the support they need to build and express their ideas while being able to share the benefits with the world.
  • This campaign will spark a pattern of positive innovation that will lead us into a better future.

Risks & Challenges

While the campaign presents a load of optimistic properties, there are difficult obstacles that come along with a campaign of this nature:

  • Having a financial goal of $2.5k isn't exactly something that can be done overnight and 2 months is quite a tight gap to allocate.
  • Although this won’t be the easiest task , collectively we will provide enough resources to assist each other in achieving the goal with success!

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that some  people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean the opportunity to help is gone, there are still other ways to  help :

  • Be sure to tell others to get the word out verbally and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! That way the reach goes beyond just one platform.

story:
First and Foremost this is a legitimate campaign!

I Know it's super silly but I'm very serious about making these if the campaign is funded.

Who's making these BabaDongs?

Hey everyone! The name is Cig Neutron! I'm a special fx artist working in Los Angeles with over 10 years of experience. I've worked on major motion pictures, TV shows, and for many youtube companies such as Nerdist, Machinima, etc. I've shown in fine art galleries all across the states with many people owning my art around the world.

Why the obviously fake name Billy Raygun? ***update*** well I'm Cig Neutron and being open about it. **** Chances are, you may know who I am. I've decided to remain anonymous (at least for now) because of the nature of the product. I've wanted to make sex toys for some time, but I don't think a decent portion of my fan base will appreciate them. This campaign is a way for me to have the freedom to make what I want, and help people in the process!

The idea for the BabaDong hit me recently (just in time for pride month!) and I thought it would be a great way to put out a fun product, and help a cause I'm passionate about at the same time. I am a huge supporter of LGBTQ rights. If this campaign takes off I will be donating 10% of the profits to The Lambert House.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is for preorders to see if there is enough interest to pursue the BabaDong. Producing a product like this is very expensive. I have the completed sculpt, but I am waiting to see if the demand is high enough before I sink money into the materials necessary to mold, cast, and produce these. I will only go into production if we hit the minimum goal of $15,000. If the goal isn't met then no one will be charged. The BabaDong sculpture will just sit on my shelf collecting dust, and give me a little chuckle every time I glance at it. The reason for the minimum goal of $15,000 is to protect myself and backers. It's a ton of work to produce a product like this. I love this idea, but the last thing I want to do is make a bunch of dildos that no one wants....

If the goal is met, the BabaDong will go into production. I will be updating all backers on the production process, so you will all rest assured that your Babadongs are getting Babadone.

The standard BabaDong will come in Black. However if the campaign takes off I have a few color options in mind that backers can upgrade to if they so desire. Colors include bomb pop, and Rainbow....my personal favorite might be bomb pop. Complicated color schemes are more labor intensive so an additional cost would be added to upgrade

**INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING AVAILABLE. IF INTERESTED CONTACT US.

The Charity

 

The Charity I've chosen to donate a portion of the proceeds to is The Lambert House. Growing up I've experienced firsthand the hate and intolerance that people are capable of. It's easy for a young mind to be convinced to hate themselves for who they are. I believe that no one should ever have to feel like that. The world is a beautiful place filled with amazing people who will love you for who you are. All you have to do is find them. Among many other things the Lambert house is there to help find those people.

***Please note that this campaign is not in anyway endorsed by the Lambert house. Honestly, they probably don't even know about it. I've just done a lot of research and they are the organization that I've decided to donate to if funded. You can read more about the Lambert house here:

http://www.lamberthouse.org

 

Risks & Challenges

The best part about this campaign is that it's risk free for everyone! Worst case scenario- it doesn't get funded, no one gets charged, and I had fun sculpting a BabaDong. Best Case scenario- it gets funded, everyone gets their Babadong, AND we help out the LGBTQ community. Any way you slice it, it's a win, win. However we don't recommend you slice the BabaDong...

I will happily answer any and all questions that arise during the campaign.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't preorder but love the idea please share to any and all social media platforms. Let's see if we can get a buzz going! You can also donate directly to The Lambert House http://www.lamberthouse.org .

story:
Fantasy Artist Reference

Hello and welcome to Fantasy Artist Reference. We have been working on this project for a couple of years now and are ready to start this campaign to bring our idea to fruition. We have worked on taking photos hiring models , building sets and props. Always looking to improve our images and make them better. We have looked at many formats and website networks to try and find the best way to deliver our images to artists. All were lacking in some way , they were just too clunking to use or not efficient in archiving and retrieving images. Many offered a host of options that just got in the way such as selling t-shirts and coffee mugs. We are doing one thing . Providing artists with high quality photographs to use in the creation of there own artwork. That is why we have decided to build the website to our specifications. Our reference will help you create new artwork that is new to the art scene. we also have an non exclusive commercial license that will enable you to market your creations with confidence. Once our site is live the cost will be about $50 for a half year and $80 for 1 year. We will only be offering 1/2 year and 1 year subscriptions. We want things to be simple and efficient. Also because our figure reference category contains nudity you must be 18 years of age or older to help fund this campaign.Why use our reference?

  • top quality photos in color and high resolution.
  • Professional models ,all over 18 and signed a model's release.
  • Non exclusive commercial license 
  • Fantasy,Pin-up,Comic and figure themes

This is what we will use the funding for

  We have figured what we believe is a realistic amount that would be effective to accomplish our goal. We have itemized what will have the most impact on our campaign.

  • 22,000. is what we have figured to be necessary to make the campaign viable.The breakdown is as follows.
  • about 4,000 for website construction and hosting server.
  • 6,000. for a medium format camera and lens that will enable us to photograph multiple actors and still maintain high resolution.
  • 4,000 to hire top modeling talent. Our images are what will set us apart from other sources.
  • 3,000 for building props and sets. We are always looking for that something extra.
  • 1,000 for legal and acct. This can't be forgotten.
  • 2,000 This is for what we don't expect.
  • 2,000 indiegogo fees and expenses.

Who can benefit from using our reference

All artists can use our reference with no royalties or other fees.

  • Comic artists 
  • Graphic novel artists
  • Pin-up artists,retro and modern styles
  • Tattoo artists
  • Fantasy artists
  • Digital artists that use today's creative tools
  • Figure painters
  • Si-Fi artists and game developers

 Challenges

We have been working on this for a while and believe we have the ability to accomplish our goal. The reason we have chosen fixed funding is that the amount would enable us to concentrate  on the project. A flexible amount might leave us hanging and prolong the delivery date. 

  • If you have followed us on tumblr you can see we have been busy creating images and building sets and props.
  • We intend to do this. indiegogo can make it happen sooner than later.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not an artist you can still join our site 

  • Tell your friends that are artists and check our instagram and twitter feeds
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hello!  I'm Tom Latourette, I'm a Children's Book author and co-founder of the BTB Foundation.  Last year, at the tender, young age of 53, I followed a life-long dream and saw my first Children's Book - "I Had a Runny Nose",published by Eckhartz Press.  The cool thing is that we were able to have 100% of the proceeds from that book go to support local families fighting cancer. 

Now I'm asking for your help to up the ante and make an even bigger impact on families, especially kids!  I'd like to enlist you to powerfully launch my 2nd Children's book - "I Had An Upset Stomach" (you can see the trend) by getting it into the hands of children fighting cancer or the children whose parents or siblings are suffering.  I'm also hoping to give those families some relief by offering them a creative respite from their battle! 

We've combined the power of 3 foundations I'm involved with and have created a cool and unique program.  We're hoping, with your help, that we can bring thousands of kids laughter, smiles and creativity while they're fighting this horrible disease.     

OUR MISSION: 

For my new book, I've teamed up with an incredibly talented artist, Ben Olson, who runs the Chicago Chapter of the Chuck Jones Center for Creativity through his non-profit the backyard EXPERIENCE.  Ben and I are looking to expand the reach of our 3 foundations by combining

  1. My new book,
  2. The art therapy of Sally's Studio
  3. AND Ben's the backyard EXPERIENCE foundation / Chuck Jones Center for Creativity Chicagoland Acme Creative Cart  

Then, we're bringing this trinity to the kids and families fighting cancer at Advocate Lutheran General Hospital, Swedish Covenant, Amita Healthcare in Hoffman Estates and other Chicagoland hospitals.           

What We Need & What You Get

In order to get this program off the ground and get the best pricing for books and art boxes we're looking for some pre-order help and funding commitments from our supporters! 

If you help us, we've created some cool ways for you to get in on the fun and giving!  

  • Buy a book and give a book to kids fighting cancer! 
  • We'll acknowledge your generosity inside each book! 
  • Each book funded will also fund a daily art experience for a child or family member battling this disease!   
  • You'll also have a chance to get your hands on one of Ben's custom, limited edition lithographs! 

The Impact You'll Make!  

Your donation will bring smiles and laughter while igniting the passions and creativity of children battling cancer.  The benefits of art therapy are numerous and can make a HUGE difference in a kids' struggle.  Please help us get these tools in front of thousands of kids and Chicagoland families!  

Information about our Foundations: 

 

The BTB Foundation: 

17 years ago my brother and I started a golf outing to help a friend and his wife who was diagnosed with breast cancer.  We had 30 golfers and raised $3K.  Fast forward 17 years - Our outing has grown significantly and last year surpassed an incredible milestone.  We've given over $1.1 Million dollars directly to 76 local families fighting cancer!   

 
http://www.btbfoundation.org/

 

Sally's Studio:  

In 2009, our Foundation helped the family of Sally Gorney-Avila, a wife and mother of 2 beautiful little girls.  Sally lost her battle with cancer but we created and started funding an organization called Sally's Studio which honors Sally's memory by conducting weekly art therapy sessions with chemotherapy patients at Advocate Luthern General Hospital. 

http://www.sallysstudio.net/ 

 

the backyard EXPERIENCE with Chuck Jones Center for Creativity: 

Ben Olson created the backyard EXPERIENCE with a mission to give children of all ages an experience to encourage their Imagination & Creativity through an expanding variety of events and programs. Ben's team accomplishes this in the areas of after school arts for Education, healing arts in Healthcare, visual articulation for Special Needs and creative events in the local Community.  

https://www.thebackyardexperience.org/

Ben has also created a fantastic partnership with the Chuck Jones Center for Creativity in California and their wonderful programs and is leading their Chicago chapter.

The Chuck Jones Center for Creativity strives to nurture the creative genius that exists in children and is looking to transform lives, communities and society as a whole.  Ben has created a Chicagoland  "Acme Creative Cart" that takes the Chuck Jones program directly to children.  

https://www.thebackyardexperience.org/chuck-jon...

 

If you can't make a donation... 

  • help us get the word out by using the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!
story_txt:
Hello!  I'm Tom Latourette, I'm a Children's Book author and co-founder of the BTB Foundation.  Last year, at the tender, young age of 53, I followed a life-long dream and saw my first Children's Book - "I Had a Runny Nose",published by Eckhartz Press.  The cool thing is that we were able to have 100% of the proceeds from that book go to support local families fighting cancer. 
Now I'm asking for your help to up the ante and make an even bigger impact on families, especially kids!  I'd like to enlist you to powerfully launch my 2nd Children's book - "I Had An Upset Stomach" (you can see the trend) by getting it into the hands of children fighting cancer or the children whose parents or siblings are suffering.  I'm also hoping to give those families some relief by offering them a creative respite from their battle! 
We've combined the power of 3 foundations I'm involved with and have created a cool and unique program.  We're hoping, with your help, that we can bring thousands of kids laughter, smiles and creativity while they're fighting this horrible disease.     

OUR MISSION:  
For my new book, I've teamed up with an incredibly talented artist, Ben Olson, who runs the Chicago Chapter of the Chuck Jones Center for Creativity through his non-profit the backyard EXPERIENCE.  Ben and I are looking to expand the reach of our 3 foundations by combining

My new book,
The art therapy of Sally's Studio
AND Ben's the backyard EXPERIENCE foundation / Chuck Jones Center for Creativity Chicagoland Acme Creative Cart  

Then, we're bringing this trinity to the kids and families fighting cancer at Advocate Lutheran General Hospital, Swedish Covenant, Amita Healthcare in Hoffman Estates and other Chicagoland hospitals.           


What We Need & What You Get
In order to get this program off the ground and get the best pricing for books and art boxes we're looking for some pre-order help and funding commitments from our supporters! 
If you help us, we've created some cool ways for you to get in on the fun and giving!  

Buy a book and give a book to kids fighting cancer! 
We'll acknowledge your generosity inside each book! 
Each book funded will also fund a daily art experience for a child or family member battling this disease!   
You'll also have a chance to get your hands on one of Ben's custom, limited edition lithographs! 



The Impact You'll Make!  
Your donation will bring smiles and laughter while igniting the passions and creativity of children battling cancer.  The benefits of art therapy are numerous and can make a HUGE difference in a kids' struggle.  Please help us get these tools in front of thousands of kids and Chicagoland families!  

Information about our Foundations:  
 
The BTB Foundation:  
17 years ago my brother and I started a golf outing to help a friend and his wife who was diagnosed with breast cancer.  We had 30 golfers and raised $3K.  Fast forward 17 years - Our outing has grown significantly and last year surpassed an incredible milestone.  We've given over $1.1 Million dollars directly to 76 local families fighting cancer!   

 
http://www.btbfoundation.org/
 

Sally's Studio:  
In 2009, our Foundation helped the family of Sally Gorney-Avila, a wife and mother of 2 beautiful little girls.  Sally lost her battle with cancer but we created and started funding an organization called Sally's Studio which honors Sally's memory by conducting weekly art therapy sessions with chemotherapy patients at Advocate Luthern General Hospital. 
http://www.sallysstudio.net/ 

 

the backyard EXPERIENCE with Chuck Jones Center for Creativity:  

Ben Olson created the backyard EXPERIENCE with a mission to give children of all ages an experience to encourage their Imagination & Creativity through an expanding variety of events and programs. Ben's team accomplishes this in the areas of after school arts for Education, healing arts in Healthcare, visual articulation for Special Needs and creative events in the local Community.  
https://www.thebackyardexperience.org/
Ben has also created a fantastic partnership with the Chuck Jones Center for Creativity in California and their wonderful programs and is leading their Chicago chapter.
The Chuck Jones Center for Creativity strives to nurture the creative genius that exists in children and is looking to transform lives, communities and society as a whole.  Ben has created a Chicagoland  "Acme Creative Cart" that takes the Chuck Jones program directly to children.  
https://www.thebackyardexperience.org/chuck-jon...

 
If you can't make a donation... 

help us get the word out by using the Indiegogo share tools!
THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Sam. I am a small-time disabled artist. I started the Mushroom and Cryptid campaign to begin creating stickers out of art that I've designed. People expressed an interest in having stickers of the designs and thus the campaign was born! Without contributors, Mushroom and Cryptid designs probably wouldn't turn into a physical item (stickers) at all, due to me being disabled and unable to afford to print off stickers myself.

What We Need & What You Get

A total of $500 is being asked for to start with. $500 will allow me to purchase diecut Mothman stickers, afford last minute shipping cost add-ons and packaging for each contributor,  afford a sample of the diecut Mothman stickers for testing (to see if a change of printing company is needed), afford fees and taxes, and to pay me for designing the sticker and for the time to package and ship everything. If the goal is passed, it will enable me to purchase more sticker designs such as Loch Ness Monster and the Fresno Nightcrawler. If the goal is doubled, I will be using the extra money to purchase Iron-on Patches of the Mothman design. If the goal isn't completely reached, all money will be refunded and stickers will not be bought.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge faced is not passing the monetary goal. If the goal isn't passed, all contributors will be refunded their money automatically because of the campaign being a fixed goal!
Another challenge is if the printing company chosen to print off the stickers prints them wrong, to test for this, a sample packet of stickers will be ordered to get a rough idea of what the stickers will look like (and to allow contributors to see a sneak peek!) and to get a rough idea of how long shipping takes. If the printing company doesn't work out, a new company will be chosen

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily to the campaign, but still want to help, there are other ways! Feel free to share the campaign with others who like cryptids and stickers. Indiegogo has share tools specifically for this purpose!

story: I’m the founder of Jiu Ba Technology. This is our latest product. It’s very beautiful. We spent 200,000 US dollars and 80 days of intensive work to develop it. To us, this is more like ours. The child is also a piece of art that we are very satisfied with. And we are going to push this product to Europe in an all-round way, and we believe it will sell well. So we are applying for a European product patent, and we are currently reviewing the patent. It’s just that our early R&D expenses are too much and the current production funds are insufficient, so we need everyone’s help. We can start production immediately after receiving these funds. Now only a deposit is required to the manufacturer.

To us, this is more like ours. The child is also a piece of art that we are very satisfied with. And we are going to push this product to Europe in an all-round way, and we believe it will sell well. So we are applying for a European product patent, and we are currently reviewing the patent. It’s just that our early R&D expenses are too much and the current production funds are insufficient, so we need everyone’s help. We can start production immediately after receiving these funds. Now only a deposit is required to the manufacturer.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:
 I'm Kelly Chao , been in the hospitality industry for long till Covid 19 came. During the lockdown i realized i've got talent and i decided to make use of the free time i have to better my talent. I've done several paint works which i sold out. I am planning to print and distribute an art book of my Quarantine Painting series. Each will be printed in color, with accompanying text explaining and discussing the intent of the piece. Scans are ready. Layout is in progress and i plan to order the book on the last day of this Campaign. It usually takes 6-10 weeks for printing, proofing and their shipping to me.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:
I'll order a print run at full size of these paintings and another at a smaller size. They may not be available again later.(Depending on how well this goes!) Prints usually take only a week or two to be ready to ship out. The funds needed to order in, ship out and prints is the goal total. It leaves me with a slim margin of extra, so i can add more items if this does well.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • I have so many art works that have been bought which made me realize i've been doing a good work.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • It's going to take quite some time to sort out and ship orders, so I've given myself a few months to get through it all in my last project I didnt give myself enough time to sign and ship everything and I ended up with a swollen wrist!!

    Not this time - I'm setting more reasonable deadlines. I've left myself a little leeway financially in case of excess cost.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Airshows Today aims to become the UK’s leading airshow and aviation events journal.

It will contain news, previews and reviews of worldwide aviation events written by enthusiasts and industry people. We'll look at airshow acts - the people and the aircraft - plus have exclusive behind-the-scenes discussions with airshow movers and shakers.

The airshow industry is large and varied within the UK and worth some £50 million a year, yet there is no current magazine representing the industry’s interests or aimed at appealing to the mass market. Audience numbers for the 2014 season amounted to some 5.7 million in the UK with the growth of seaside shows and there is a great opportunity to appeal to the young. If just 1% of the potential market could be captured this would mean sales in excess of 50,000 copies.

The next few years offer many opportunities for national exposure with the continuing Great War commemorations and the centenary of the RAF in 2018.

Worldwide the airshow industry is expanding and becoming ever more professional. Social media and the Internet will enable a worldwide market for digital and direct sales.

The first issue is planned for publication in October 2015 and will review the past season while looking ahead to 2016. It will be a minimum of 60 pages and if successful will launch as a bimonthly publication in the Spring of 2016.

story: We need nearly Usd 500000 . We use this amount for land purchase. Buildings and infrastructure. We want to protect old traditional crafts. Like handlooms, weaving, and handicrafts. We are started this art Village in smallscale.We also running one organic plants nursery. Named ecofriends. We want to create more and more rural employment opportunities with these skills. This project also ecofriendly. Creating employment opportunities without using power and hydrocarbons. It is ecofriendly user friendly,  farmer friendly and employment creating project.

story:
Hi friends!

SEKTA is presented on a market for 6 years and fron the first day we are working with young artists and designers and support them.


Who we are?

We are community of young people, artists, designers, who adore modern art.


What we do?

Any young artist can send us his pictures. We print it on T-shirts, bags etc. and sell on our internet shop all over the world and the young artist receives % from it and promote his name and talant in this way. Designers send us also ideas on fashion design and help them the same way. 


What we plan and what we need?

We hope to spread our community here and get funding on

- set up of moving gallery, there all young artist can present their works and we are going to show all over the world. Every month our gallery will move to other country. It will promote young artist, their talent, a number of people will come closer to modern art. Its so important our days to turn people to art, peace...

-  paying rentals for gallery, exhibitions

- our promotion on internet


What you get?

The most important thing - you help young artist, you support moving gallery and do not forget about our greate perks ))) Lets have a look at it.

P.S.  Look at our gallery to choose an item and write us on seva.ere@gmail.com after you buy a perk


1. Digital thank you card -  its surprise we will not show it now :)


2. Bag on your choosing. You can choose also other bags from our gallery. Look at it and donate :)



3. Leggins for fashiom girls. Also have a look at gallery



4. T-shirt - look at gallary and choose any one you want



5. Super trousers :)



6. Fashion hoddie :)



7. Hoddiescarf&hat (2 items)  



8. Unique sweatshirts :)


Other ways you can help

If you like our idea and want to help, share this link with your friends  http://igg.me/at/p8iuVnExv3U/x/11597082


Only togather we can make moving gallery, support young artists and make people closer to modern art. So, join us, donate, share link and lets make it!

story:
La necesidad de poder seguir financiando KBolá Project nos llevó a crear PB (Poco Bonito) Project, una galería de arte constituida por un colectivo de artistas (Amet Laza, Osmany Caro, Alberto Veloz, José Montes, Carlos Fdez, Mario Fernández e Inmaray Tillet), un disenador digital (Rolando Miranda), un artista espanol (David Azeituniya Gutierrez Sanchez) y el manager, Carlos Infante, quien subscribe estás palabras. Si les interesa saber más al respecto pueden visitar la web antes mencionada y nuestro Facebook (Poco Bonito).

Iniciamos este proyecto en Agosto de 2014, tuvimos un poco de suerte para encontrar el local, aún cuando la renta no es muy barata, pues hay poca disponibilidad de espacios para negocios de este tipo, Cienfuegos es una ciudad pequeña y con un muy bajo acceso a internet, si no estás en la calle principal no existes, especialmente si los artistas con que trabajas son casi todos muy jóvenes y sin reconocimiento en el mundillo del arte, muchos autodidactas pero con un gran compromiso con la comunidad y el artivismo, ese el criterio de selectividad que hemos utilizado para sumar artistas al proyecto.

Nuestro problema radica que el propietario de la casa quiere venderla y entonces nos veremos forzados a cerrar, hemos buscado otro lugar donde continuar con Pb Project, que es más que la galería pues además es un lugar de reunión para la gente alternativa y donde brindamos hospedaje gratis a aquellos que nos visitan y se mueven dentro de la cuerda de la alternatividad. Hemos parado de buscar sin parar y en las calles donde pudiera funcionar la galería no ha aparecido nada, decidimos ampliar la búsqueda a lugares menos favorecidos e incorporarle café y tragos para hacerlo viable, pero ni aun así apareció un lugar para rentar. Las personas me preguntan que si tenemos un contrato con el propietario, No lo tenemos, así funcionan las cosas acá, contratos verbales que se mantienen en dependencia de la ética de los contrayentes de dicho trato, la verdad que no nos podemos quejar del comportamiento del propietario, ha sido una relación respetuosa, nosotros hemos pagado en tiempo siempre todos los pagos de la renta pero ahora él tiene otros intereses con su vivienda, nos lo informó hace ya un año pero nada hemos podido encontrar para rentar en este tiempo por eso recurrimos a crowdfunding para recolectar 40k que necesitamos para comprar una vivienda que nos permita seguir adelante con los proyectos que hemos realizado.

Es un crowdfunding atípico porque generalmente se aplica para gestionar un proyecto pero en este caso el proyecto ya existe, sería para continuarlo, además se pide que delimite el tiempo que se va a realizar, nosotros no podemos hacer eso porque luchar por el mejoramiento humano no tiene fin. Ademá muchos proyectos funciona muy bien durante el tiempo que reciben financiamiento, pero una vez que cesa la ayuda se pierde todo el trabajo, nosotros pretendemos ir tan lejos en el tiempo como podamos o sea necesario. Si a eso se le adiciona las dificultades con la internet y la paypal, entonces es una misión casi imposible pero no podemos dejar morir algo por lo que hemos trabajado tan duro, así que esperamos de sus colaboraciones.

Estamos dispuesto a retribuir sus donaciones con obras de arte, así que le pueden echar un vistazo a la web o nuestras páginas en Facebook, y escoger algo que se asemeje al valor de la donación que estén dispuestos a dar.
