story:
Passion is the energy that keeps us going, that keeps us filled with meaning, and happiness, and excitement, and anticipation. Passion is a powerful force in accomplishing anything you set your mind to, and in experiencing work and life the fullest extent possible.

Stars, Celebrities are followed by their millions of Fans are around the world. Apart from admiring & following their stars, fans also draw inspiration from their favorite Stars.

There are millions of fans around the world who spend there valuable time and money to get a glimpse of their stars, to acquire an autograph or photo or something related to their stars. Equally there are 1000’s of upcoming artists around the world from different fields who would like work to be appreciated and would like to sell their arts, photos to their fans so that they can continue to work on their passions and succeed in their life.

A simple search on the web will throw us 100’s of stories in which artists from various fields could not continue on their passion because of lack of opportunities, resources, platform to communicate and most importantly financial support. Not everyone is born with a silver spoon or in an environment and surrounding which nurture's and support's their passion.

Few motivation stories of Stars from various stages of life have conquered their passion to excel in their areas.

Shania Twain - She was born and raised in rural Ontario by her mother and adoptive Native American father, Eilleen Twain had to cope with food shortages as a child and resort to hunting and chopping wood for supplies. She sang in local bars at only 8 years old (strictly after last call) to help support the family, who still often relied on aid from Toronto homeless shelters. After high school however, Twain took her talents on the road to develop her singing-songwriting craft. Despite gaining strong traction early on, she was forced to return home to support her younger siblings after her parents died in a car accident. Once her brothers grew old enough to take care of themselves, she resumed her career under the Native American name “Shania”, meaning “I’m on my way”. Shania was on her way to musical superstardom—the only female artist in history with 3 consecutive certified “diamond” status albums, and a net worth  of $350 million.

Usain Bolt - He came from a village that had no running water and no street lights. His upbringing was also a difficult one. When he turned into sports, he initially loved to play cricket but eventually became a sprinter. He wanted to do something for himself and for his village. He realized his true passion since then there is no look back. Bolt had shocked the world by breaking world record after world record aside from winning multiple Gold medals in multiple Olympic Games. The fastest man on the planet has definitely worked his way from the bottom to the top.

J.K. Rowling - Living in a cramped apartment with her daughter, jobless and penniless, Rowling fell into a deep depression and admits she even considered suicide. She was forced to rely on state benefits and spent much of her time writing "Harry Potter" in cafés with Jessica sleeping in the pram next to her.

"An exceptionally short-lived marriage had imploded, and I was jobless, a lone parent, and as poor as it is possible to be in modern Britain, without being homeless ... By every usual standard, I was the biggest failure I knew," Rowling said during a 2008 Harvard University commencement speech. Her manuscript was rejected by 12 different publishers but her she never gave up. She received an £1,500 advance) by editor Barry Cunningham from Bloomsbury, a publishing house in London. Although Bloomsbury agreed to publish the book, Cunningham says that he advised Rowling to get a day job, since she had little chance of making money in children's books. Soon after, in 1997, Rowling received an £8,000 grant from the Scottish Arts Council to enable her to continue writing. And there was no turning back for her.  The 2016 Sunday Times Rich List estimated Rowling's fortune at £600 million, ranking her as the joint 197th richest person in the UK. In 2012, Forbes removed Rowling from their rich list, claiming that her US$160 million in charitable donations and the high tax rate in the UK meant she was no longer a billionaire. In February 2013 she was assessed as the 13th most powerful woman in the United Kingdom by Woman's Hour on BBC Radio 4.

M.S. Dhoni - He was the ex- captain and wicket keeper of the Indian cricket team in all formats of the game. Although his family originally belongs to Uttarakhand, Dhoni was born in Ranchi where his father Pan Singh worked in a junior management position with a private sector company. Dhoni excelled in sports in school and was selected to play cricket for the 1997/98 season Vinoo Mankad Trophy Under-16 Championship. Later, he joined Indian Railways and worked as a Train Ticket Examiner (TTE) at Kharagpur railway station from 2001 to 2003. His colleagues remember him as an upright and honest worker, with a mischievous side to him Dhoni and his friends once dressed up in bedsheets as ghosts and scared the night guards at the railway complex. But Dhoni never gave up his passion he knew within that he is born to play cricket and he will succeed one day in his life. Soon that turned into reality and as they stay rest is the history.

Dhoni holds numerous captaincy records such as most wins by an Indian captain in Tests and ODIs, and most back-to-back wins by an Indian captain in ODIs. He received many awards the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award in 2007 and the Padma Shri in 2009. In June 2015, Forbes ranked Dhoni at 23rd in the list of highest paid athletes in the world, estimating his earnings at USD 31 million. 

We would like to quote famous words by Martin Luther King Jr.

Which say's,  “If you can't fly then run, if you can't run then walk, if you can't walk then crawl, but whatever you do you have to keep moving forward.”  

Our goal & Our vision is to see every artist from around the world is connected with their fans without any boundaries between them. With FansnStars as a medium we would like to support every individual who are passionate about the things which they love whether it's Star of a Fan. They should always connect with their true passion.

Referring to famous speech in 1963 by  Martin Luther King Jr - "I have a dream".

As an individual we all have dream's and we should rightly have dream to do something in life both professionally & personally.

We should give our best to achieve those dreams,  "Leave no stone unturned".

Ultimately, passion is the driving force behind success and happiness that allows all of us achieve those dreams. We would like to help every passionate individual's who dream, and who want to achieve their dream's and be a Star in their lives.

FansnStars would love to be a part of your journey to success.

Be a Star on FansnStars !

 

Who are we ?

FansnStars is a unique form of business, which involves two main existing businesses Social networking &  e-Commerce.

 

Problems we noticed  ?

  • As an upcoming artists it is very difficult to find the right, genuine fans who could not only appreciate the artist's talent but also support him/her to continue on their passion.
  • And as a genuine fan it is equally difficult to secure a genuine and signed autographs, memorabilia or to buy original painting's, designer apparels etc.

How are we solving the problem ?

  • FansnStars will have a ready to use platform for artists, they just need to signup and start selling directly to their fans worldwide.
  • Fans will be able to support their stars buy directly buying from their stores.

FansnStars would like to revolutionize the way memorabilia, autographs, artwork, designer apparel are bought and sold to fans around the world. An artists can be a upcoming or established star. Artists can be a small screen, theatre, sport stars or from any other fields such as writer’s, authors, musicians, painter’s, poet’s. All of them from any part of the world will be able to reach their genuine fans through FansnStars.

​
Currently the team size is 2 who have been working part-time on the platform and engaging with business and various artists. We would like to build a core team and at the same time we would like to take the platform to the market.

 

Mission Statement: Our mission is to be the leading platform for an artist selling almost anything which fans will cherish to own.

 

 Our Major Challenges 

Till date FansnStars is a self-funded and insufficient funds have impacted our growth and progress and we end up with all those common challenges which each startup’s usually face.

Competition:  As a startup competition is a major challenge for us. We have been constantly trying to keep up with the trend and have been innovating to enhance the platform and services keeping the core values of our idea. We would like to provide a unique experience to all our users on our platform. And yes, there are certain core features which makes FansnStars different and unique from other social media platforms.

Adding talent: Lack of funds have impacted us from hiring new talent to help us to tackle the startup’s growing needs. And this has been our biggest challenge. A startup requires full time dedicated team which works on the core business. With the right amount of funding we will be overcoming this challenge.

Fast-paced market:  We kept innovating to keep up the pace with the changing trends and have improved our platform to match with the latest trends that deliver truly new value. But we never got distracted so much that could makes us invaluable.

Slow growth: All the above together impacted our growth plan. We would like to end the campaign with the high & positive note. We like to overcome all these challenges by right support and launch the platform end to end before the mid of this year valuable.

We are ultra-focussed on the core values and we have survived on it and we are determined to succeed. We need your whole-hearted support to make FansnStars a leading social commerce platform in the world.

 

How the funds will be used ?

By end of this year we would like to achieve certain milestone and atleast generating a revenue of upto £500K. And in order to achieve this growth, we are looking for funds to make investments in a variety of areas, and fund cash flow requirements for the next 12 months of operation.

Funds will be used mainly to build 3 areas of business:

  1.  To build the core team
  2.  To scale and sustain the business and
  3.  To reach the right audience.

The Company is seeking upto £377K(includes the campaign fees) to finance these activities. The timing of our entrance will be critical.

Funds will be utilized: 

  1. Setup Cost (Tech/Equipment/Start-Up).
  2. Hiring & Forming a core Business team:

Engineering Team

Sales & Marketing

Finance & Accounts

Support & Legal

  1. Strategic Alliance.
  2. Contract with Stars/Various artists.
  3. Marketing & Advertising.
  4. General & Administrative Expenses.

With your support and backing we we will be able to take the platform to the market with a huge buzz. FansnStars is ready with all the essential features.
story_txt:
Passion is the energy that keeps us going, that keeps us filled with meaning, and happiness, and excitement, and anticipation. Passion is a powerful force in accomplishing anything you set your mind to, and in experiencing work and life the fullest extent possible.Stars, Celebrities are followed by their millions of Fans are around the world. Apart from admiring & following their stars, fans also draw inspiration from their favorite Stars.There are millions of fans around the world who spend there valuable time and money to get a glimpse of their stars, to acquire an autograph or photo or something related to their stars. Equally there are 1000’s of upcoming artists around the world from different fields who would like work to be appreciated and would like to sell their arts, photos to their fans so that they can continue to work on their passions and succeed in their life.A simple search on the web will throw us 100’s of stories in which artists from various fields could not continue on their passion because of lack of opportunities, resources, platform to communicate and most importantly financial support. Not everyone is born with a silver spoon or in an environment and surrounding which nurture's and support's their passion.Few motivation stories of Stars from various stages of life have conquered their passion to excel in their areas.Shania Twain - She was born and raised in rural Ontario by her mother and adoptive Native American father, Eilleen Twain had to cope with food shortages as a child and resort to hunting and chopping wood for supplies. She sang in local bars at only 8 years old (strictly after last call) to help support the family, who still often relied on aid from Toronto homeless shelters. After high school however, Twain took her talents on the road to develop her singing-songwriting craft. Despite gaining strong traction early on, she was forced to return home to support her younger siblings after her parents died in a car accident. Once her brothers grew old enough to take care of themselves, she resumed her career under the Native American name “Shania”, meaning “I’m on my way”. Shania was on her way to musical superstardom—the only female artist in history with 3 consecutive certified “diamond” status albums, and a net worth  of $350 million.Usain Bolt - He came from a village that had no running water and no street lights. His upbringing was also a difficult one. When he turned into sports, he initially loved to play cricket but eventually became a sprinter. He wanted to do something for himself and for his village. He realized his true passion since then there is no look back. story:
We are a small family gallery, which was established in 2008 by Pristavec’s daughter Ivana, an art historian and her husband Igor Unuk, multimedia and computer specialist. The main aim of our gallery is to preserve the artistic legacy of Janez Pristavec, who was incredibly prolific, producing more than 6000 works during his lifetime. 


We are working on this project since 2008 and now almost a decade after his death, we feel that It’s the right time to introduce his large opus to the world. We managed to digitalize and systematize a large part of his oeuvre in the last years, however the final step we want to achieve is to exhibit his works in eight largest galleries in Maribor in the coming year, preferably around April 2018. We also want to establish a complete and permanent virtual internet gallery with his works after April 2018.  

To manage to do that, we must:

  • make better digital copies of some of the pieces
  • clean and repair works on canvas
  • clean and repair works on paper
  • prepare all works for exhibitions
  • organize and promote exhibitions

In January of 2017 we have organized a commercial exhibition in Maribor, as we are aiming to gather resources any way possible. Indiegogo campaigning is a completely new experience for us but it makes complete sense to broaden our efforts in this direction as well.  

We are a small dedicated team and we unfortunately live in country with a broken culture and art based economy model. We have been meticulously preparing the material for years now and we have put a lot of our resources, time and finances into it. 

2018 is fast approaching and we are really confident about the material that we want to show, but we need additional funds to properly prepare the pieces. We carefully selected the works that are for sale and can also be used in all sorts of campaigns. We feel this is a great way to exchange cultures and to find support on a global scale. 

This campaign is a completely new experience for our small gallery. Since our opening in 2008 we were really active in dealing with the local art scene - http://galerijaunuk.weebly.com/ - and putting together Pristavec’s collection. We studied many campaigns, spoken with curators at home and abroad, attended lectures in contemporary art and consulted several art critics and we think we’ve put together a representable package, which enables our supporters to put some quality art on their walls and help us successfully finish the Pristavec project.  

A contribution for this campaign is specifically planned for expenses regarding the restoration, revitalization and digitalization of 400 selected works on canvas representing a major part of Pristavec’s retrospective. We have one of the best Slovenian restoration masters as our adviser – M.A. Nada Madžarac, the director of the restoration center at the Museum of Contemporary Art Metelkova in Ljubljana - and we will spend the funds on professional teams of art students, chosen and advised by her.

Restored works will be put in proper frames, finalized and prepared for the exhibition in April 2018. All the works will be professionally photographed, digitalized and showcased as a permanent internet gallery after the exhibition concludes. So the campaign mostly covers pieces on canvas, but if any money is left, it will be put to use to fund the restoration of the works on paper. A large part of the oeuvre on paper (around 70 %) is already properly archived. However, two really interesting collections on mashed paper need expensive restoration procedures and some of the early works need to be treated with special care by removing any dust particles and strengthening the structure. 

We have some unique, high quality perks in the form of three original graphic art pieces called Woman with Hen on a Horse, done by Janez Pristavec in 1980. They were done in a series of 10. We didn’t sell any pieces until now, since we have to properly prepare all of them. This is a good opportunity to get an original Pristavec piece for an affordable price, before July 2017, when we plan to sell first works to gather resources for the final part of the campaign. The available original graphic art from 1980 is in mint state.

We have carefully selected the presented works of late Janez Pristavec out of approx. 2300 pieces. 

All reproductions for this campaign were printed as test specimens in one of the best local print shops, which prides itself with a two decade long tradition of replicating art of supreme quality. All prints were additionally checked by three specialist. We plan to start printing pieces a month after the launch of the campaign, because bigger orders mean a better printing price. After 3 days of printing we plan to spend 2 days preparing the packages. The idea is to start shipping them right after that. We will repeat the process in a month’s time, when the campaign concludes. 

All reproductions will be printed in limited series and used exclusively in this campaign. Each piece comes with an official gallery signature and certificate.

We carefully constructed our perks out of all available awards. We also consulted several specialists for graphic art and art historians regarding our selection, prints, prices, art markets etc.

If we do not reach our goal, we will ship works to all the people that contributed to the campaign and use collected money to restore at least a part of the work on canvases.

If funding goes really bad, we will calculate expenses and send your money back if printing and sending will not be financially viable. 

We think we’ve made a reasonable offer for a good price that will help us gather a part of the needed financial support to present Pristavec’s fine collection. 

We think that culture is really important. It is a vital part of contemporary and future society. It is our goal to provide insight into a big part of Slovenian art history. A deeper look into this collection reveals an intelligent, progressive, unrelenting drive for artistic research and experimenting. 6000 pieces represent an almost complete collection of a dedicated, sometimes even obsessed artist, who reflected life in his city, captured its people and looked into and worked through his inner and outer states from 1968 to 2008. After 90 exhibitions staged in his lifetime, now, a decade after his death, we feel he deserves a wholesome retrospective and a proper digital presentation that will delight visitors, researchers, art historians, collectors and the interested public in general for many years to come.

Since we are doing this kind of campaigning for the first time, we’re more than open for any suggestions in all aspects of the experience. We will gladly answer all your questions and take time for your suggestions. Please feel free to contact us on all web and RL channels!


www.pristavec.info

story:
Short Summary

What’s a better way of an Architecture Student to express his love about art and raising money for his own gallery than starting a Kickstarter Campaign, right !? I’m Mario a fourth year architect with a love about comics, movies, Tv Series, cars, anime, nature and every other aspect which can be granted by art.  

    As a painter, according to my personal believes, one of the greatest and most important characteristics of a gallery must be variety.  

    Humans are emotional beings after all. Each individual is touched by different features which impact differently in its own individual mind based on there life, believes and emotional state. Therefor, The challenge which I focus to succeed is reach as a large demographic as possible by using different subjects, colors and structures in every painting, so that anyone can find something he admires in one or more of my creations.  

    Every painting, like everything else in life, whether it’s a book, a Netflix show, a movie or a person of great importance, is nothing if not impactful in our lives and that stuff of great importance in anyone’s well-being, i find great joy when I’m able to create.  

 

- Interaction between the Mind and the Hands cannot be achieved, Unless the heart is the mediator. 

 

PRODUCTION

PRINTS 

* Each of the paintings produced are available as limited edition wallpapers which are laminated into regular strong canvas paper attached to the crate and at the end of the process is filtered with oil paint.  

* My printing company produces the highest quality and resolution image. 

* Each will hand signed by the artist. 

* Each will be send in each own painting-protecting box.  

* Each limited to an edition of only 100. 

* Ships worldwide. 

 

PRODUCTION PROCESS  

 

* 1 step : gather every email of every backer, contact them for the specific painting they want and ask them their specific country, state, address and zip code.  

* 2 step : after the ending of the funding process  the production of every painting will begin which is gonna take a maximum duration of 3 weeks.  

* 3 step : building the protecting boxes for the transfer  

* 4 step : sign authentication papers which will be inside the shipping box  

* 5 step : the shipping, which will take maximum of 1 week depending whether the shipping address is in Europe or America. 

* 6 step : Enjoy the high quality Oiled Canvas at your door.  

SHIPMENT  

* ACS Courier Co. is going to be shipping the products Worldwide and hand them at your door as long as We receive your address. Shipping payments are included in the price of each product.
story_txt:
Short Summary
What’s a better way of an Architecture Student to express his love about art and raising money for his own gallery than starting a Kickstarter Campaign, right !? I’m Mario a fourth year architect with a love about comics, movies, Tv Series, cars, anime, nature and every other aspect which can be granted by art.  
    As a painter, according to my personal believes, one of the greatest and most important characteristics of a gallery must be variety.  
    Humans are emotional beings after all. Each individual is touched by different features which impact differently in its own individual mind based on there life, believes and emotional state. Therefor, The challenge which I focus to succeed is reach as a large demographic as possible by using different subjects, colors and structures in every painting, so that anyone can find something he admires in one or more of my creations.  
    Every painting, like everything else in life, whether it’s a book, a Netflix show, a movie or a person of great importance, is nothing if not impactful in our lives and that stuff of great importance in anyone’s well-being, i find great joy when I’m able to create.  
 
- Interaction between the Mind and the Hands cannot be achieved, Unless the heart is the mediator. 
 

PRODUCTION
PRINTS 
* Each of the paintings produced are available as limited edition wallpapers which are laminated into regular strong canvas paper attached to the crate and at the end of the process is filtered with oil paint.  
* My printing company produces the highest quality and resolution image. 
* Each will hand signed by the artist. 
* Each will be send in each own painting-protecting box.  
* Each limited to an edition of only 100. 
* Ships worldwide. 
 
PRODUCTION PROCESS  
 
* 1 step : gather every email of every backer, contact them for the specific painting they want and ask them their specific country, state, address and zip code.  
* 2 step : after the ending of the funding process  the production of every painting will begin which is gonna take a maximum duration of 3 weeks.  
* 3 step : building the protecting boxes for the transfer  
* 4 step : sign authentication papers which will be inside the shipping box  
* 5 step : the shipping, which will take maximum of 1 week depending whether the shipping address is in Europe or America. 
* 6 step : Enjoy the high quality Oiled Canvas at your door.  
SHIPMENT  
* ACS Courier Co. is going to be shipping the products Worldwide and hand them at your door as long as We receive your address. Shipping payments are included in the price of each product.

story: We need your help to become an ethical, eco-friendly, ‘Slow Fashion’ bridal wear brand. Our vision is that Maison M’Elise could expand into an international bridal fashion brand, known for its integrity, sustainability and ethical creation of bridal wear as well as providing an empowering work environment for skilled women sharing ideas and helping to minimise the impact of the bridal wear industry on the planet.
story_txt: We need your help to become an ethical, eco-friendly, ‘Slow Fashion’ bridal wear brand. Our vision is that Maison M’Elise could expand into an international bridal fashion brand, known for its integrity, sustainability and ethical creation of bridal wear as well as providing an empowering work environment for skilled women sharing ideas and helping to minimise the impact of the bridal wear industry on the planet.

story:
Humanity, the Exhibition

Hello, we are Helen Needham, Nadine Anderson Cheng, Gilles Hurtaud, Allison Kotzig and Love Weber. 5 Artists who are advocates for a better, happier, and more environmentally conscious world.

Humanity, the Exhibition was created to fulfill the persistent call, to use the power of Art as a catalyst for social change. And we have been fortunate to be offered the opportunity to take this exhibition to 3 major cities.

With over 30 pieces of art, Humanity, promises to be visually and mentally stimulating, as each professional artist specializes in a variety of media, from oil painting to sculpture, photography to film. Inspired by current affairs, and by people like you. 

Many of the artworks focus on the environment— being kinder to our homeland, Earth. Other works look at the growing integration of different cultures through migration, human rights, with the twists and turns of colonial history, family traditions, sedation through technology, and human interactions with the power of love to start a conversation of healing. The exhibition interactive elements, pull the viewer through the doors of self discovery, while its video installations listen to the many voices of the world speaking in unison with their views on today's humanity...you may be surprised at the universal consciousness on the rise. 

We believe that you and visitors to our exhibition will be positively impacted by this thought-provoking collective that reflect daily life—seeing us all as one people.

We hope you will get Plugged in with us as we embark on this exciting adventure to educate and enlighten, to successfully spread awareness with a message of love and the importance of community well-being! 

We know that with your generous contributions, this tour to Köln, Basel and London between May and July, 2019, will come to fruition.

A Glimpse of Our Work:

See Our Story on our website: www.HumanitytheExhibition.com  and visit our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/HumanitytheExhibition/posts or Instagram @HumanitytheExhibition to view one of our video installations.

What We Need

We have made rental deposits at each location, borrowed a bus for transportation and made sofa sleeping arrangements at family and friends to save costs:

  • We need approximately €6,200 to complete our gallery rental payments, purchase gas and acquire materials to build display stands and partitions.

& What You Get!

Our gifts to you for your donations?

  • Lets Be Humane Again - buttons
  • Lets Be Humane Again - 100% cotton ethically manufactured reusable large tote bags 
  • You will be one of the first to own prints of our Art! 

  • Special Sneak Peek video insights and photos of the artists working process
  • Sponsor status: All of the above, Plus! one-on-one private tour of the exhibition with one of us and your logo* on our advertising materials! 
  • and of course, You also will get our deepest gratitude, and society's countless thanks!!

Our artistic team

We are fortunate that, on our team, there is a frugal teacher/book-keeper and a professional marketing specialist, each with over 20 years experience. All artists are creative, and quite handy with a saw and hammer, giving this project a direct path to success in reaching its happy goal with your help!

Thank You for Donating now!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

So you can't contribute? You can still help!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Share it with everyone!
  • Be a part of the exhibition! Make us a [under 1 minute] video on "What you think of today's humanity?" and send it to us! HumanitytheExhibition@gmail.com
  • Like our Facebook page @HumanitytheExhibition
  • Of course, please come visit us at the exhibition in Köln, Basel and London!

Our Warmest Regards from Helen, Nadine, Gilles, Allison and Love <(yes, his real name)

story:
This Idea for Table-Art was created when I was at my daughter's apartment in NYC, she was living in a very small apartment she had no space for a coffee table or for a dining or desk table. So I came up with the idea of Wall Hanging Art that turns into a coffee table and also a desk or dinning table. 

Table-Art a great new patented idea In decor designed and invented by Mark Watts 24”X 36” beautiful anodized aluminum framed wall art that transforms into  an art faced coffee table and extends into a desk table. Hanging picture frame size is 24" X 36", 2" thick / Coffee table height 17" high / Desk table height 28". The art is changeable and ships with 4 great changeable prints one is a Transformer print of Mark Watts Art. You can hang horizontal or vertical with 2 holes on Horizontal side and 2 on Vertical side. Also hangs well with 3M 17 Lb Velcro. Unit Weight is 14Lb. 

Transformer Artist Mark Watts is the Original G1 Transformer Artist from 1981 and beyond he Illustrated 45 + boxes for the Transformer kids toys.

Also the Inventor of this Transforming Table-Art.  

Own some of his Transformer Art and other Art to help fund this great project.   

What We Need & What You Get

We created a prototype that worked well, although it needed some refinements. I thought what a useful great space saving concept so I researched the idea to see if a patent existed, to my surprise no one had a patent on this concept and no product like this existed in the market place. I already had my drawings and a working prototype so I applied for a patent and received a full patent in about 18 months. After about 10 prototypes we refined the product Table-Art to a streamlined very well constructed useful product. The 14 Lb weight is sturdy enough to be a table yet not to heavy to lift and hang on a wall. Made out of quality materials, anodized aluminum and stainless steel screws so the product will never rust. It is constructed so the art is fully interchangeable and ships with 4 pieces of art included.

We really need your help funding this great useful space saving product. In order to make this affordable we need to produce a large enough volume to keep price down. We need to make tooling, molds, dyes and parts for a large production. So please help us fund this space saving and useful product Table-Art. If you are one of the first to help us you can receive your own Table-Art at a great savings of the retail price and also receive 4 great Mark Watts prints,  Transformer print, Tropical Car print, Wine print and  Tropical Sail Boat print shown. 

I have a full Patent No: 9,295,323, B2 

The Impact

This product is a great for space-saving areas like apartments small homes or just to have an extra when table when needed. 

Features:

- Framed Wall Art that transformers into a coffee table and desk table.

- Has changeable art use any art or photo you like 24” X 36”.

- Ships with 4 great changeable pieces of art.

- Quality constriction materials anodized aluminum, stainless steel rust proof.

- Stable weight of 14Lb for coffee table, desk table and easy weight to hang. 

- Hangs horizontal or vertical with hanging holes in unit, also can be hung with 3M 17Lb  Velcro. 

Make It your own / Add any family photo, photo, art or Transformer Art you like 22" X 34".  Any Prints can be used in Table-Art, holds up to 4 prints. Unit ships with 4 Mark Watts prints. Add new prints any time you like.  

Risks & Challenges

The challenge is producing this new product Table-Art, a well made functional product with high standards. We were on top of this by producing a series of prototypes over 15, Then when the prototype was perfected we went on to produce a small number of hand done prototypes. We had people use them and see how they held up in everyday use. These were expensive because all hand done. We needed to work out potential problems in functionally and quality. Now that we have a good understanding of the product we need to produce plastic ejection molds for all connectors for aluminum as well as extruding aluminum molds. All materials on this product are non rusting and durable materials. With a high quality anodized aluminum frame. The delays could be in ejection molding and extruding tooling for aluminum but we don't think this will be a problem because we are working on this early in the production of the project. This product is made up of a number of parts in that we needed to produce punch dies for ect. We are only working on this project Table-Art so it has our full attention, this will be a cool, great space saving quality product with nothing like it in the market place. The only other challenge we see is if this product Table-Art does very well, is keeping up with a large production run. Please help us fund this great new useful space saving product, Thank You!

Other Ways You Can Help

I am Mark Watts / Transformer Artist Mark Watts is the Original G1 Transformer Artist from 1981 and beyond I Illustrated 45 + boxes for the Transformer kids toys.

Also the Inventor of this Transforming Table-Art.  

Own some of my Transformer Art and help fund this great project.   

22" X 34" Prints Direct from my Studio these are Giclee prints, printed on premium luster photo paper archival Inks, signed by artist Mark Watts and can be used in Table - Art and are available in perks area,  * Signed Transformer prints from Mark Watts Original Transformer Art direct from his studio. 

* These print perks will help fund this great new space saving and functional product Table-Art with Transformer Art Included.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Nyx Deck

The Nyx Deck is a modern, unique and high quality playing cards deck.

  • Printed by MPC playing card company
  • Unique design and durable custom plastic box
  • High quality Linen finish


Creators

The Nyx Deck is created by TheNyx Magic. TheNyx Magic is a magic YouTube channel, and community. It's CEO/creator is Matthew. Go check out TheNyx Magic here:  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_GvWUwkJ_JVR7ShEkth9Fg


Why should I contribute?

There are two reasons why YOU should contribute to this project:

  • To put the Nyx Deck in everyone's hands
  • To get a deck if you've pledged enough for the perk
  • Remember, the more you buy, the more you get! (Example: the brick of Nyx Decks is only 127€ instead of 214€ normally) So get your Costco mentality on, and buy in bulk!


Stretch Goals

Here are some stretch goals:
  • 510€ - Custom Seal
  • 600€ - 4 uncut sheets
  • Infinity€ - More decks and uncut sheets proportional to the pledges amounts
  • 4000€ - Printed by USPCC on Bicycle© quality cards

Risks & Challenges

There will be a couple risks and challenges throughout the campaign:

  • Not getting enough funds (Matthew will contribute some money if not enough)
  • Long shipping (We will try to make it as fast as we can)


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, or you want to help more:

  • Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+...
  • Tell all your friends who would be interested

story:
Short Summary

 

It will be fascinating to see what everything will look like once finished.

Trying to imagine what a great deal would be to share perspective in art with people around the world, this campaign. 100 Surreal Landscapes in one month represents a journey of more than 7 years into painting, a deep dive in search for a sense of unity with nature.

After years of Joy and growth in both technique and aesthetic, a YouTube channel was created to share art with you.

A few friends help to make this idea real along with you. Valentin is the Photographer of the campaign, Simona is the manager, Daniel is the video editor, and yours truly creates the Paintings.

Together we can make a difference, have a positive impact and spread the Joy.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Nature a connection between the human mind and our spirit, drawing inspiration from the feeling that gives us. The emotion of being outside and enjoying every bit of life within ourselves. This motivates artists the in the act of creation.

This campaign is named “The forest of joy” exactly for this reason. It means freedom, art and imagination feel real and palpable, everything is possible if we all accept that gift – the feeling of being in nature. Surrounded by trees, witnessing its greatness and kindness feeling this inside your chest and allowing it to express itself through art - is the greatest thing ever experienced.

This feeling is equal to the feeling that you know you can help anyone - every single day, inspire, work with them, and keep on going.

For this to be possible canvases and acrylic paint will be needed. That’s all. If you invest in those then you can do magic. A number of 8 perks are available for you, with original landscape paintings at different sizes and layouts, more than that, everyone can watch the progress of the campaign and how intense and wonderful the world can be when people work together.

 

 

The Impact

 

Giving art as a gift is lovely and always surprising. It is a sophisticated way to say: ‘thank you’ or ‘Happy Birthday’, a great gift to remember your friends or family of you. Us painters know that it’s a warming feeling – giving away something that came out from our soul and through the tips of our fingers.

You have the opportunity to give a part of an artist as a gift to your loved ones.

At the end of everything you will know that you have been part of something great, not only that, but you made everything possible. You will also have something to remember it by, and show everyone.

 Let’s see how the world reacts to this campaign. Share the Joy

 

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Have this amazing chance now, to change something in the artworld.

This idea serves as a challenge, the way things are getting done already changed. Because this is passion and having the opportunity to create is what life is all about. All artists have an insatiable thirst for creating and sharing. No matter how tired they are or how hard they worked the day before. You want to be productive and see what the next painting will look like every day.

There is no doubt – this campaign will succeed.

However, this will only be possible if you chose to share and donate.

Your help and your support will make all of this possible.

 

 

 

 

Ways You Can Help

 

There are a lot of ways You can help, either by contributing or Sharing the campaign with others. You decide if this is a worthy campaign and if it will see the day of light.

For now it’s a Dream waiting to be lived.

A Journey waiting for the first step.

A seed for a Forest of Joy.

Thank you for everything,

Thank you for proving that this world is amazing, and for showing everyone else that it is so.

story:
About Cathy Hill

I am an artist, who has been living, working, raising children and exhibiting in Egerton, Kent, for over 25 years. With a sock-knitting needle and a tin of wax-oil crayons I create pictures that are intended to uplift and inspire my viewers about “What is magical in our every-day lives?”

It is extremely exciting  for me, to be having this big exhibition of my work, in the beautiful town of Whitstable this October (5th-14th 2018)

The Show is interactive, providing free art workshops for school children. Visitors will be creating a collaborative, community artwork with me and will visit the special space to contemplate the 'magical'.

It is time that I burst forth, with my colourful artwork, into the wider world because I have a plan... and am passionate about helping non academic children realise their own unique talents, potential and possibilities for creating a happy and successful life.

During my work with children, I was deeply moved by a 7 year old boy, who believed that he was a total failure. He couldn't learn academically and said to me "I'm no good at nuffink", but the two of us would sing together and he had an amazing voice and ability to dance!  No-one knew, he didn't even know himself, however when told, no-one was able to take any action.

Through sharing my ideas  for "It's a Magical Life!" and about this young lad, I found a sponsor and a singing/dancing tutor for him. There are many children out there, with talents that need some nurturing and I would like to help.

I aim to raise £7,777  to fund the exhibition and this campaign; from Gallery fees and insurance to printing and posting; from staffing and running the show, to workshop materials and wine for the preview.

I have great PERKS!!:  vibrant T-shirts, mugs, tea towels and prints to offer you, for your financial support + 10 places on my special Art Workshop Day  (Date TBC), and even a unique original artwork of your own 'magical place'!

Every contribution will help me fund this show, even if I don't make my target, and any extra will help further the progress of "It's a Magical Life!", the community Interest company. Even just sharing my crowdfunding site with everyone you know, will help enormously. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

To raise money this way is a challenge for me.The organisational skills I am developing are surprising! Please donate now and I promise to send you colourful prizes in November (or before if I possibly can).

Thank you all, for your support.

Cathy

story:
Kamptastic

Hello everyone my name is Catherine “Kampie” Manno. I am 38 years old and I absolutely love anything having to do with art and music. I suffer from many chronic issues that I am not letting defeat me. I have found the love of my life Callie and desire to make the most of lives from starting my own business. 

My campaign is rather simple. I would love to have a business producing journals and planners for those with chronic illness, lack of motivation, and to get healthy. I would love to have a brick and mortar at some point which I hope to live above or beside. This money would be a start up to getting things to sell to save up for the big picture. Also, to create more items to run bigger and better campaigns.

I want to create something that brings positive light to the wired world out there. There needs to be time to unplug and give yourself a moment to make sure you are on track for the life you want, need, and deserve. Your donation will help that, also you can receive some really neat stuff. The world needs more understanding of people and by letting out our feelings we can figure out what is really going on when life travels down that stray path here and there.

The Breakdown

Right now I am striving for a donation of $2500. I know it seems a lot for some coloring books, and you are right. However you are not just funding my coloring book, but helping me start a business!

 

What your money will be used for other than living expenses:

  • Producing the perks. (Of course!)
  • Creating prototypes so I can test and see what works
  • Paying friends for their services like driving and testing products as well as doing anything I can’t do because of my chronic issues.
  • I would love to have an actual desk in my home, the TV tray doesn’t always cut it.
  • Keeping a roof over me and my business is $360 at the moment hopefully I can get into a lower income apartment. I currently live in a strip club basement. It is not glamorous as one might think.
  • Advertising on Facebook. Once I get this campaign going there will be a page for the business. I feel advertising correctly could help get the brand noticed.
  • Getting my business going for more fun motivational products.

 

The Perks

The unique perks are going to be pretty exciting if you are a fan of adult coloring! It’s great for children as well!

The main book will be beautiful designs with geometric and floral shapes along with positive quotes. This is the starting idea. Donations will go to producing the perks first. You deserve something for being so generous to help me. I am hoping that through the funding I can add more pages to the book as time goes on. Will also be adding pages for previews of my journals and planners. 

I plan on having some key chains, book marks, coloring pages, habit trackers, coloring habit trackers, as hands on previews of other items in the Kamptastic brand. These will be included in some of the perk bundles

I assure you your donation will go to great use on my part and yours. Also you will be added to the Kamptastic Fan Club, StarShines,which will offer you discounts and first look at new items.

Now if I do not reach my entire goal some perks may suffer, and I would really not like to let anyone down. Make sure to support to get the best out of your donation by sharing it with your friends.

This is Very Important to Me

This is my passion project. I want to make the world a better place and I know it is not something I can do on my own. I hope that starting Kamptastic will allow me to help others in their goals even if the world seems to be against them. Offering tools to help others is a great start. The journals I have created for myself have helped me out a lot in trying to get my issues under control.

I do have a great passion for this project and I hope to succeed in it. Any questions, comments and concerns can be asked for answering in an update, which will be as often as I can.

What Could Go Wrong?

Lots… but I am superior with damage control.

I am not a well person. I struggle like most humans. I have a few health issues piled on as well. Some days I am fatigued, engulfed in a brain fog, and unreliable to even my close friends. I do worry about not meeting deadlines I set for myself.

I will indeed overcome these issues. I have an excellent support system of loving friends who check in on me daily to make sure I am getting things done. This will happen, I am passionate and have a fire burning, I am trying to get better and healthier. I want others to know that achievement.

Not the Right Campaign for You

Number one thing I hear is, “I have no money…” Don’t worry I do not expect anyone to support anything that they don’t want to. If it’s not your thing that is fine, please do not feel you have to explain. Maybe you could share using some of the great tools that Indiegogo offers? I know one share could go a long way

story:
Dear friends, my name is Manuel Granai; I am a painter and art restorer, who works in the beautiful city of Granada in Spain. You can see more of me and my work in these links:

 

https://www.instagram.com/manuelgranai/    

https://www.facebook.com/ManuelGranaiArt/

https://www.manuelgranai.com/

What you get & what we need

I had the idea of creating this calendar for the year 2020. It is a beautiful artistic calendar, illustrated with old photographs by Wilhelm von Gloende, a great German photographer (1856-1931), who developed his career primarily in Taormina, Italy. He is famous for his photographic studies of young Sicilians, who generally appear with very careful poses, in spaces with classic references.

Size: 59 x 42 cm.

Portada del calendario

    Page of the month of April

    In case you don't need a calendar, I have also created two more very interesting options:

    • A decorative sheet or poster of one of his most famous photographs; He is a thoughtful young man sitting on some rocks. And you can frame it to your liking to decorate any wall of your house.​ ​

            Size: 59 x 42 cm.

     

    • And a collection of 12 photographs of this author; Presented in a practical cardboard box. Size: 21 x 15 cm.

     

    The money raised will be used to pay the printing and assembly costs of the calendar, the collection of photos, and the printing of the poster. Also to pay the shipping costs, which will be included in the price of each reward.
    After paying all production costs, commissions and taxes; With the benefit we have left, a donation will be made to help children to the UNICEF Organization.

    DONATION

    ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    The Rewards

     

    • Calendar Taormina 2020. 

    14 pages illustrated with photographs. Calendar size, 59 x 42 cm. Shipping costs are included in the price:

    To ship to:                                                

    • USA ........................................................ 29 euros

    • EUROPE ................................................. 25 euros

    • SPAIN ..................................................... 20 euros​

     

    • Box with photo collection​

    Box with collection of 12 beautiful photographs of Wilhelm von Gloeden; size 21 x 15 cm.  Shipping costs are included in the price:

    To ship to:                                                

    • USA ........................................................ 29 euros

    • EUROPE ................................................. 25 euros

    • SPAIN ..................................................... 20 euros​

    ​

    • Poster for decoration

    Famous photograph of Wilhelm von Gloeden, size 59 x 42cm. Shipping costs are included in the price:

    • USA ........................................................ 25 euros

    • EUROPE ................................................. 20 euros

    • SPAIN ..................................................... 15 euros​

     

    GREAT OFFER

    You can get a large price reduction by buying more than one item, 15% of the total will be deducted if you buy more than one unit.

    Example:

                                              2 - calendars.............................................58 €

                                                                       - 15%..........................   8,7 €

                                                                                                 __________________

                                                                         49,3 €

     

    Risks & Challenges

    I have everything very advanced, all the designs are already finished and in the press, just waiting to give the order to print, once the campaign is over.

    It will be important to obtain the correct shipping information from everyone in a timely manner. Make sure your information is updated here at Indiegogo, and if you have any questions or problems, do not hesitate to contact: manuelgranai@gmail.com

    All shipments will be made by registered mail, to avoid losses. And he would arrive at his house in the first days of January.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't afford to make a donation, don't worry - you can still help by spreading the word about this fundraising campaign! Please share our link on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and other social media platforms, and encourage your friends to donate.

    Thank you so much for reading, and thank you especially for your support! You can make a huge difference - Consider donating to support UNICEF today.

Risks & Challenges
I have everything very advanced, all the designs are already finished and in the press, just waiting to give the order to print, once the campaign is over.
It will be important to obtain the correct shipping information from everyone in a timely manner. Make sure your information is updated here at Indiegogo, and if you have any questions or problems, do not hesitate to contact: manuelgranai@gmail.com
All shipments will be made by registered mail, to avoid losses. And he would arrive at his house in the first days of January.
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't afford to make a donation, don't worry - you can still help by spreading the word about this fundraising campaign! Please share our link on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and other social media platforms, and encourage your friends to donate.
Thank you so much for reading, and thank you especially for your support! You can make a huge difference - Consider donating to support UNICEF today.

story: I've been learning 3D technology over the last few years. I always found the content in the training just didn't align with my personal interests.  Robots and cars don't pique my interest. I'm a surfer and surfing piques my interest. It's time to bring 3D Surf Art and Animations to the world. I've developed some unique wave materials (shaders) for surf art, and learned the various techniques to make 3d surf art and animations. But, I'm not hoarding my knowledge on this. Instead, I'm giving it away quite cheap. By providing you with complete scenes as well as video training, I'm certain you will be able to create your own great surf art and learn 3D technology in the process. The software used is Blender - version 2.82 and migrating to version 2.83 once it is ready. This will work even with relatively low end machines (I'll show you the tricks to make that happen), but a better machine with a better graphics card will always perform better. As long as your computer is less than 5 years old, you should be good because we're going to use techniques to heavily optimize efficiency in the 3d meshes. I'm going to develop on a relatively new machine with a mid-scale graphics card, but I'm going to also test everything on a 2011 Mac Mini to ensure it works well with low end machines.

story:
A zine celebrating 3 years of ChikaRiko! On October 7th, 2015, Aqours released their first single, Kimi no Kokoro wa Kagayaiteru kai? (Is your Heart Shining?). Three years later, 14 artists and 9 writers got together to answer this question and create this zine. (banner art is by shinyyyytrash on tumblr and liabidraws on twitter)

Now, a year after the release of IYHS?, it finally goes to print. It is completely dedicated to ChikaRiko, and is full of love for them. 

Every $15 dollar donation will receive a copy of this zine. It is planned to be 60 pages long, saddle-sitched, with 14 full-color art pieces and 9 fanfiction pieces.

Please consider supporting this project!

story:
DALÍ’S DAUGHTERS

Dali's Daughters is a surreal figure drawing workshop, that allows customers the complete freedom to creative expression. Participants will be provided with a canvas and drawing materials, and a heap of nude models to draw to their hearts desire. A soundscape of enhanced sound effects will provide a source of inspiration for the artists. Contrary to most figure drawing classes, there will be an absence of a teacher, meaning the artists will be free to cultivate their own styles and drawing methods. On top of creative expression, artists will be provided with the perfect networking sphere of likeminded individuals.

Introduction & Background

Founded in 2017, under the name ‘Jagazeen Life’, Dalí’s Daughters began as a life drawing event catering for stag and hen parties. However, after pursuing this market for some time it appeared quite difficult to locate the target market without a strong web presence and a large marketing budget. This, alongside the ethical position of the company, provoked the shift from the stag party market, to the general public.

Sitting in on a lecture at the Universitat Bellas Artes, the colourful history of Salvador Dalí was unveiled, and inspired the shift from ‘Jagazeen Life’ to Dalí’s Daughters. This change in name provided a sturdy theme for the events, and also captured an already existing segment of Dalí fans. This opened the doors to many opportunities and it was not long before a dedicated following of Dalí’s Daughters was formed.

Based upon the absurd character of Dalí, famous for his paintings and sculptures, but less well known for his bizarre fly eating habits, and colourful orgies held with his wife as the protagonist. Dalí’s Daughters has become a unique project of surrealist life drawing, designed to attract those who believe in a sustainable view of art and the human body. In this fragile era of technology and political unrest, Art can be a vital and volatile distraction from the pressures of society to succeed, in a time when the recipe to success is still being written. This project is designed to strip the supposed ‘reality’ from its haunches, and reveal what is really real. In the end, we are consciousness disguised within human bodies, disguised beneath fashion and money.

The founder of Dalí’s Daughters has extensive experience in the life drawing sector, and it has become apparent that many organizations appropriate the human body, handing out certificates (‘I love to draw big tits’), and treating models with casual disregard. This has stemmed from a culture of online pornography and appropriation of bodies as something to abuse and manipulate. For this reason, a platform of respectful, cultural artistry seemed well overdue. Dalí’s Daughters provides this platform, taking the ‘pornography’ from nudity, and promoting free expression and entertainment.

Business model

The core business model of Dalí’s Daughters can be segmented into 5 parts:

  1. Purpose: Art for Art’s sake: Dalí’s Daughters has been created with the intent to promote freedom of expression and a healthy attitude toward the human body. The act of drawing is also proven to be highly meditative and relaxing, and excellent exercise for the brain. In addition, the classes exist as a private sphere, wherein people are able to discuss the political upheaval in the surrounding world, and escape the prevalent moral panics that are overtaking the media. There is no alternate motive behind the project, merely to get back to the roots of humanism and reveal the colourful history of art in times of political upheaval. The project is aimed not just at artists, but also toward compete novices, as a free space to try their hand at creativity.
  2. Business Process: The business process follows a linear line of action. The marketing of the brand and the events is consistent, whereas all other business processes are acted out in a ‘Just in Time’ structure. This is accounted for in the infrastructure of the company too, wherein all models and space are hired solely for the duration of the class. There is no permanent office space, nor permanent employees. This reduces the need for high fixed costs, and adds a flexibility to the business model.
  3. Target Customers: Using Meet Up as the primary source of advertising, the target market has automatically revolved toward the tourist segment. Many visitors look at events on Meet Up in order to make friends and experience a little of what Barcelona has to offer. As the platform is segmented into categories, ‘Art’, ‘Hiking’ etc. it is easy for customers to locate the project. Art university residents are also one of the primary target segments. The business model caters well for students as classes count toward research and classwork for schools, and are held in the evening when most people are free from school or work.
  4. Culture: The nature of Dalí’s Daughters as a nude figure drawing clan means that the culture surrounding the brand is tangible. Each model and participant brings a unique perspective to the events, and discussions continue on online platforms well after the classes take place. The aforementioned ‘cult-like’ following is a major part of the company culture. Each participant is dedicated to the brand, and tries to enhance the effectivity of the events by bringing props, sound bites and costume to add to the flavor of the events. For this reason, Dalí’s Daughters has grown into a collaborative business model, wherein the market sews into the tapestry of the business, a postmodern bricolage of a business.
  5. Inspiration: Born and raised in Figueres, Dalí is famous for pushing the surrealist movement in Spain. His character was considered largely eccentric, and for this he was penalized by wider society, however his work continues to be cherished globally. This is the ethos that runs in the undercurrent of Dalí’s Daughters. Whilst much of the public may perceive the ethics behind the organization as offensive, due to the nudity, the work is respected for its uniqueness, and a large following is cultivated.

Unique Selling Propositions

The USP of Dalí’s Daughters lies within the uniqueness of the project. Where there are many life drawing events held, none are as specific and daring as Dalí’s Daughters.

  1. A multitude of models, of all genders and ages.

Each event employs 3 models, generally two females, and one male. This allows drawers to pick and choose their subject, and allows them to view the concrete difference between the gender forms. Generally, figure drawing provides a single model, and this model is the focal point, leaving little room for creativity. In Dalí’s Daughters, participants can experiment with which style suits the individual body, and actively observe the notion that ‘all bodies are different’. After all, many people have never had the opportunity to observe a singular nude form, let alone multiple, it is a truly enlightening experience.

  1. Mise-En-Scene

Most competitors favor the ‘white room, bright light’ approach in figure drawing, believing that the best practice comes from an obvious, central subject. At Dalí’s Daughters we negate this belief. The room is strewn with props and the models are adorned with costumes. Often, artists will be found drawing the papier mache rabbits, or the glowing moon orb, instead of the models themselves. This pinpoints to the artist a distinct contrast between the drawing still life, and real life, as well as injecting a little kookiness to the finished work.

  1. Moving Models

It is a well-known fact that life models must be well versed in the art of staying still. In Dalí’s Daughters this is not a requirement. Whilst the models are encouraged to hold a pose for as long as possible, they have the freedom to switch positions whenever they feel. This normally occurs in time with the soundtrack. Whilst this can be tiresome for the artist, the message is clear ‘life drawing’, is life, and life is full of movement. The resulting sketches are full of movement and life as a result of this. This is also an attractive USP for the models, who enjoy being treated as living people rather than statues.

  1. Sound and Light

We are living in an era of augmented and virtual reality, wherein cinemas are pumping smells into the audience to provoke sensory stimulation. Dalí’s Daughters excites the senses by layering a hand crafted soundtrack over the class. The artwork produced tends to follow the vein of the soundtrack at any given time, in a way that is reminiscent of synesthesia. Each sound draws the focus point to a different curve of the body, or a different method of brush stroke. Feedback largely revolved around the use of soundscapes throughout the session.

  1. Nude Staff

An unplanned element to the evening has been the addition of nude staff. More of a gimmick than a USP, this helps the models to relax and ‘normalizes’ nudity. Participants enjoy trying to draw the mobile staff members. This also gives the opportunity to show the human body in action, how the muscles move, and how actions are normally hidden beneath a layer of fabric.

Future Plans:

Dalí’s Daughters will run on a weekly basis, using a rotation of models and customers. Future events will be held in a house, or in the Bellas Artes school. A partnership with Bellas Artes will be set up to ensure the future of the business, but as of yet there are no plans to register the business as a company until proper profits come rolling in. Global expansion is being discussed, with volunteers willing to hold events in New Zealand, Mexico and Brighton, under the name Dalí’s Daughters. Future sessions will include full house figure drawing, wherein artists will move around the room, drawing figures placed on beds and sofas and toilets. Live music and snacks will accompany the events. In this case, events will be priced higher due to the addition of competitive advantage and USPs.

Crowdfunding Capital

All Crowdfunding capital gained from Indiegogo will be invested into the company to help it to grow. Backers money (30%) will be put toward purchasing mannequins, which will be an investment, but will also reduce the number of models needed to be hired each session.

30% of the funds will be put towards advertising and promotion, helping Dalí’s Daughters to reach global recognition.

The remaining 40% of capital raised will be used to register the name as a company, so we can begin to be legally recognized. 

Contact Information

Dalí’s Daughters can be contacted through the Facebook page, website, or through the company phone line.

www.indiegogo.com/projects/dali-s-daughters-drawing/x/11931880#/

www.facebook.com/jagazeen

www.jagazeen.com

+34 648 795 525

Barcelona, Spain
story_txt:
DALÍ’S DAUGHTERSDali's Daughters is a surreal figure drawing workshop, that allows customers the complete freedom to creative expression. Participants will be provided with a canvas and drawing materials, and a heap of nude models to draw to their hearts desire. A soundscape of enhanced sound effects will provide a source of inspiration for the artists. Contrary to most figure drawing classes, there will be an absence of a teacher, meaning the artists will be free to cultivate their own styles and drawing methods. On top of creative expression, artists will be provided with the perfect networking sphere of likeminded individuals.Introduction & BackgroundFounded in 2017, under the name ‘Jagazeen Life’, Dalí’s Daughters began as a life drawing event catering for stag and hen parties. However, after pursuing this market for some time it appeared quite difficult to locate the target market without a strong web presence and a large marketing budget. This, alongside the ethical position of the company, provoked the shift from the stag party market, to the general public.Sitting in on a lecture at the Universitat Bellas Artes, the colourful history of Salvador Dalí was unveiled, and inspired the shift from ‘Jagazeen Life’ to Dalí’s Daughters. This change in name provided a sturdy theme for the events, and also captured an already existing segment of Dalí fans. This opened the doors to many opportunities and it was not long before a dedicated following of Dalí’s Daughters was formed.Based upon the absurd character of Dalí, famous for his paintings and sculptures, but less well known for his bizarre fly eating habits, and colourful orgies held with his wife as the protagonist. Dalí’s Daughters has become a unique project of surrealist life drawing, designed to attract those who believe in a sustainable view of art and the human body. In this fragile era of technology and political unrest, Art can be a vital and volatile distraction from the pressures of society to succeed, in a time when the recipe to success is still being written. This project is designed to strip the supposed ‘reality’ from its haunches, and reveal what is really real. In the end, we are consciousness disguised within human bodies, disguised beneath fashion and money.The founder of Dalí’s Daughters has extensive experience in the life drawing sector, and it has become apparent that many organizations appropriate the human body, handing out certificates (‘I love to draw big tits’), and treating models with casual disregard. This has stemmed from a culture of online pornography and appropriation of bodies as something to abuse and manipulate. For this reason, a platform of respectful, cultural artistry seemed well overdue. Dalí’s Daughters provides this platform, taking the ‘pornography’ from nudity, and promoting free expression and entertainment.Business modelThe core business model of Dalí’s Daughters can be segmented into 5 parts:

Purpose: Art for Art’s sake: Dalí’s Daughters has been created with the intent to promote freedom of expression and a healthy attitude toward the human body. The act of drawing is also proven to be highly meditative and relaxing, and excellent exercise for the brain. In addition, the classes exist as a private sphere, wherein people are able to discuss the political upheaval in the surrounding world, and escape the prevalent moral panics that are overtaking the media. There is no alternate motive behind the project, merely to get back to the roots of humanism and reveal the colourful history of art in times of political upheaval. The project is aimed not just at artists, but also toward compete novices, as a free space to try their hand at creativity.

Business Process: The business process follows a linear line of action. The marketing of the brand and the events is consistent, whereas all other business processes are acted out in a ‘Just in Time’ structure. This is accounted for in the infrastructure of the company too, wherein all models and space are hired solely for the duration of the class. There is no permanent office space, nor permanent employees. This reduces the need for high fixed costs, and adds a flexibility to the business model.

Target Customers: Using Meet Up as the primary source of advertising, the target market has automatically revolved toward the tourist segment. Many visitors look at events on Meet Up in order to make friends and experience a little of what Barcelona has to offer. As the platform is segmented into categories, ‘Art’, ‘Hiking’ etc. it is easy for customers to locate the project. Art university residents are also one of the primary target segments. The business model caters well for students as classes count toward research and classwork for schools, and are held in the evening when most people are free from school or work.

Culture: The nature of Dalí’s Daughters as a nude figure drawing clan means that the culture surrounding the brand is tangible. Each model and participant brings a unique perspective to the events, and discussions continue on online platforms well after the classes take place. The aforementioned ‘cult-like’ following is a major part of the company culture. Each participant is dedicated to the brand, and tries to enhance the effectivity of the events by bringing props, sound bites and costume to add to the flavor of the events. For this reason, Dalí’s Daughters has grown into a collaborative business model, wherein the market sews into the tapestry of the business, a postmodern bricolage of a business.

story:
See paintings at: https://fitdance-ave.com/paint-portray

As if you would stroll down the cobblestone streets of picturesque "Montmartre” with its art galleries, painting studios and lively “Place du Tertre”, where for decades, internationally known Artists, like Picasso, have been living and painting. This is how "Paint & Portray" was born, to bring Montmartre to your doorstep!

 

 

A timeless gift for your dear ones and a home decorated with paintings which all have a special meaning to you, upload your picture, choose your reference painting/style (the “to-be-like-this”) and let our Artists translate it into a magical piece of Art. Compared to the traditional way of buying a painting already created by an Artist, part of the creativity is shifted to you.

 

What you'll get: we will paint your favorite picture according to the style of your choice. You can select:

  • among 4 different painting styles (a caricature portrait, an oil painting, an ink painting and an origami painting)
  • or Coupons to chose any painting style you like from our online Gallery

 

How it works: Once the Campaign is ended, we will immediately contact you for uploading your picture and starting your painting.

1. The Artists

Over 25 Artists active at Montmartre are collaborating in this project, who are originally from over 15 different countries, known on several continents. You can meet them in person at Montmartre.

 

2. Variety of Styles

  • With a panoply of reference paintings, we put the accent on “artistic interpretation” instead of “re-production” and on choosing a concrete reference painting/style instead of just an artist like on other websites.
  • The paintings vary from gift ideas of 50€ to masterpieces of over 1.000€; true art made affordable since we do not have any costly gallery facility/staff. Note that painting from a picture requires more time and concentration, which results in a higher price.

 

3. Interactive & international

  • The website has an interactive design with an animated Gallery
  • Truly global, the website is already translated in 4 languages.
  • Your painting can be printed on gift items such as cards, bags etc.

 

The Paint & Portray website went live on August 1st 2019, and has shipped its first paintings ordered on the website (see testimonials on our website). We seek 9.000€ funding for our “Market Launch” phase.

 

  • Art is Humanitarian - we believe that the painting of someone or something you love brings happiness. The funds will be used for 15 free Charity Paintings for elderly, sick, poor people or Humanitarian associations (we pay for shipping fees). With your consent, we will include your names as donators and publish on our website the story of those people (average 200€ / painting) = 3.000€
  • Art is Inter-cultural: the funds will be used for adding 6 languages which we cannot cover through our network of translating friends (500€ /language) = 3.000€
  • Art is Worldwide: bringing Montmartre to the homes of the world, the funds will be used for mailing potential customers in 20 countries through buying email lists (150€ /country list) = 3.000€.

 

"Paint & Portray" is part of "Fitdance Avenue", a private limited company created in 2018 in Paris and focused on developing themed online platforms dedicated to the artistic world. Founded by T. Elisabeth Lam and Dominique Dagois, both former IT consultants who leverage their knowledge of technology to promote art in today’s digital era.

[T. Elisabeth]: "I painted myself when I was student but never made the step to live my passion as a profession. I’m happy I can live it now, through this project, promoting great paintings and great artists. Dominique, too, loves Art, and spends his free time at galleries and museums …”
