What We Need & What You Get

IMVERSE has some amazing tech that can take 360 photos and programmatically turn them into a true to scale 3D model. The rough preview is what you can see in the campaign video. From there the team goes in to break out all of the objects individually, clean up textures, and make sure that the assets will render properly in WebGL, Unity, Blender, Etc.

The cost of this service is $1050, which is beyond the MeshyFlesh means. Hence a crowdsourced campaign to see if we can preserve this legendary spot in the forever of cyberspace. 
We were blown away by the difference between visiting Room 201 in the IMVERSE demo vs 360 photos in VR. Even in it's rough state, the IMVERSE demo gave us flashbacks to be there doing the initial captures. Being able to visit Room 201 in VR is something we want to share with you, and our $20 perk is a lot less expensive than a ticket to Japan (assuming you are outside of Japan).
Developers of Virtual Reality and Video Games can spring for access to the high quality assets which are tested for compatibility across the common softwares. Animators and enthusiasts will be able to load the models in Sketch Up, Meshlab, or Blender and go to town. Surveying existing asset stores, the $50 mark is fair for a unique room full of objects, all textured and ready to drop into your environment of choice. 
Risks & Challenges
There's really no risk here, if we make the goal then IMVERSE will perform the service they have demonstrated around the world. Check the quality of their work on twitter, vimeo, and facebook.
Additional funding on top of the $1050 (please let us have this problem) be used to capture more, different l̶o̶v̶e̶ fashion hotel rooms. We have 360 photographers on the ground in Japan with knowledge of the most unique spots to ensure any follow up captures will not disappoint. 

IMVERSE? MeshyFlesh?

IMVERSE is democratizing virtual and mixed reality content creation. The company is a spin-off from EPFL developing software and providing services for photorealistic Mixed Reality content creation. Their volumetric solutions reduce the time and money spent on pre-production phases of Virtual Realty marketing experiences and Hollywood movies by a factor of 10. This is only possible thanks to our proprietary rendering and simulation engine and our easy and fast process to transform a single 360-degree 2D picture, from any commercial camera, into a 3D VR/MR room-scale experience with live hologram actors and real-time VFX.
MeshyFlesh is a yung smol company exploring possibilities in VR without fear of taboo. We're woke to the issues that sexual images in mass media create, but believe exploration of personal fantasies is creative and self-fulfilling. This is one of our first experiments but have lots in store if we find the support (Hiiiii angels!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the video, formatted for social and free to download!
Share this campaign link especially with all your freaky friends!

story:
WELCOME! I’m Nitasia Roland ~ I am a writer, poet, artist, independent researcher, and publisher of esoterica. I work in a design studio I founded called Urania Press. I have curated and designed TAROT CHIMERA, bringing the beguiling Symbolist art of Odilon Redon to contemporary Tarot. The deck is interpreted from a “chimeric” perspective, encouraging transformation through art and divination, deepening our connection to our dark and light identities, dreams, mysteries, and the realms of spirit.

 Chimeras are creatures of the imagination that carry dreamers away.

     As an animist, it is my philosophy that everything in this world is imbibed with a spirit. I believe the 19th-century French lithographer, painter, and pastellist Odilon Redon knew this on a profound level and sought to invoke chimeric spirit into all his sublime visions, turning his solitude, dream-filled imagination, and weird and uncanny intrigues into art.

     In 2020 I was called to curate and digitally enhance Redon’s art (that is over 140 years old) aligning it to the Major and Minor Arcana. I interpreted the cards in the style of the traditional Rider-Waite-Smith system, and I chose in some instances to depict cards with gender-neutral characters and non-heterosexual couples. I have also designed 10 additional Oracle cards as part of the campaign’s Stretch Goals, which will make a total of 88 cards.

     TAROT CHIMERA is a divination tool for self-knowledge that allows its user to tap into a unique chimeric nature through the boundless imagination and universal mysteries of what I call Odilon Redon’s “Arcana”: his dark, mystical and magical archetypes and symbols, with the intention to shed luminous light onto our path, face personal demons, transmute negative energies, foster expansive realities, revealing the hidden aspects of self that need transforming or alternatively would benefit from being acknowledged and bravely expressed.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

     

 

     

     As an undergrad for my Bachelor of Fine Arts degree, I worked in the Art library and discovered a magnificent book by Philippe Jullian called Dreamers of Decadence about the Symbolist artists of the fin de siècle 1890s. The book’s overarching theme is that of the Chimera, no longer a hybrid monster of Classical myth, but an archetype of the Symbolist’s manifesto of metaphorical and symbolic imagery and mystical and hermetic ideals, created as reactions against rationalism and matter-of-fact realism. Symbolist works of art and literature elevate the elemental and sublime in nature, the mystique of the feminine, symbolic dreams, the occulted subconscious, decadence, Romantic ideals, and the fantastic vagaries of the imagination. I loved the paintings and prints by Fernand Khnopff, Gustave Moreau, and Jean Delville, which appealed to my Gothic sensibilities. In particular, I felt a personal affinity with the artist Odilon Redon (1840-1916).      Redon’s prints, particularly his collection called Noirs, were dark and uncanny, and steeped in the otherworldly. Alfred Werner, the writer of The Graphic Works of Odilon Redon explains: “Art enabled him to channel the demoniacal forces from the depths of his self into well-integrated, well-designed images that, despite their astounding aspects, console and comfort with an amazingly soothing lucidity.” It was this aspect to Redon's artwork that left a lasting impression on me.

     While being home due to Covid, I stumbled across an old journal where I had pasted Xeroxed copies of Redon’s prints and noticed one image that resonated as ideal for the Tower card in the Tarot deck. I did a Google search and discovered much of Odilon Redon’s artwork was in the Public Domain. For all of 2020, I searched museum archives matching Redon’s enigmatic imagery to the Tarot. The cards fell into the Arcana so perfectly it was as if Redon’s spirit was giving me the “go-ahead” to bring his work into the divination context. TAROT CHIMERA was born. After six months of searching for just the right fit, digitally enhancing in Photoshop around 100 Redon images, repairing poor quality museum scans in need of repair, and adjusting the final 78 (plus 10 Oracles) to the Tarot card format, I then began the second phase of this project: composing a Companion Guidebook interpreting the deck from a “chimeric” mythos and perspective.

 “I must also have a dark side if I am to be whole.”  – Carl G. Jung 

     The Arcana of Odilon Redon seeks the ancient paths of sympathetic magic and dreams in order to find the balance between the conscious and the subconscious levels to reframe difficulties and channel beneficial forces for growth and transformation. It is a meditation tool for unlocking personal truth through myth and the metaphysical, symbolism, acknowledging the value of the shadow, and intuition.    

     Through self-awareness and looking deep within, interacting with the chimeric nature of a given situation has the potential to help the querent navigate aspects of the darker expressions of self. Through honing in on the chimeric within a given thought, action, or experience, a conversation can arise and beneficial information can be attained. Perhaps banishments of trickster spirits are in order, or, alternatively, there may be alliances ready to be made for positive outcomes.

      A true visionary, Odilon Redon, from the inner depths of psyche, dream, and the unconscious, rendered deep shadow and luminous light (tenebroso and chiaroscuro) into an assortment of mysterious beings and unknown forces: mystical figures of the ancient world, ancestral apparitions, charmed objects, hybrid figures (chimeras), phantoms, amorphous microbes and bacteria, disembodied heads, winged-beasts, angels, Sun gods, Buddhas, cyclops, sphinx, spiders, snakes, skulls, skeletons, dice, sentient flora and monstrous fauna, martyrs wearing crowns of thorns, shining stars and luminaries, and eyeballs floating as hot-air balloons.

     When drawing a single TAROT CHIMERA card, or laying out a spread, it is hoped that an affinity is inspired by Redon’s enigmatic visions and that the querent will find the chimerae charming and soothing, relevant, divinatory, and transformative, while placing, as the Symbolist artist explained of his work, “the logic of the visible in the service of the invisible.”

 

78 Large Tarot Cards: 22 Major Arcana Cards and 56 Minor Arcana Cards

Dimensions: 75mm x 130mm (2.95 inches x 5.12 inches)

Printed on heavy, casino-quality Playing Card stock with an embossed Linen finish, assuring easy shuffle and wear resistance

Keywords Mini Booklet (fits in Tuck Box)

Beautiful Tuck Box printed on matte premium cardstock 

Manufactured by Legends Playing Card Company LPCC

Embossing and Gold Foil designs on Tuck Box

Designer “First Edition” Tuck Box Stamp Seal 

 10 Oracle Cards (The "Visionary" Oracle is designed as a Urania Press brand card.)

 Note: the Companion Guidebook has in-depth interpretations matching each of the 78 cards and the 10 Oracles, aligning them to the Rider-Waite-Smith system.

MAJOR ARCANA ~

MINOR ARCANA ~

Suit of Wands:

Suit of Cups:

Suit of Swords:

Suit of Pentacles:

The additional 10 ORACLE Cards:

Chimeric beings are nature spirits in every way

 

     The charming card back is a double-ended format designed from Odilon Redon’s print "Perversité" (1891). Isn’t she alluring with her coy, over-the-shoulder glance! What secrets will she be whispering as you shuffle through your TAROT CHIMERA cards?

The Chimera is a mythic hybrid creature of antiquity depicted with the body of a lion, with both a goat and lion’s head and a serpent’s tail. It is a creature of strength and cunning representing a symbolic and mystic connection with wild feminine energy. The Chimera is a conduit of fantastic dreams that can be embodied and cultivated within. Ambiguous, baneful, and seraphic, its form is both attractive and repulsive: “she is a promise of the Ideal, with the body of a carnivorous beast,” explained the French Symbolist painter Gustave Moreau.

     The word “chimera” comes from the Greek meaning “she-goat.” In the Middle Ages, the Chimera was considered an ill omen of natural disasters and came to symbolize toxic views of women as “wicked.” A more enlightened contemporary conception understands the Chimera as the reconciliation of both the bold and brazen aspects of the feminine: (passionate and seductive, femme fatale, links with the underworld, mystery, intuition, the subconscious, drawn to temptation, perversity, liberation, impulsive, willful, and capricious), integrated with the aspects of the feminine that embody the personification of nature, love and beauty, nurture, sensuality, sympathy, generosity, and kindness.

Classical conceptions of the Chimera:

19th Century Symbolist Chimeras:

      The 19th century fin de siècle Symbolist artists exalted the Chimera. They painted Les Chimères in many imaginative variants, evoked from the inner depths of dream and the unconscious. A plethora of numinous and liminal forces, untamable creatures, delightful follies, melancholic beauties, tricksters, spirits, entities, and beasts: winged horses, unicorns, satyrs, sphinx, angels, merfolk, gods and goddesses, sentient plants, disembodied heads, ancestral apparitions, and delightfully capricious bacteria.

     The key to embodying the Chimera is non-repression of the senses, embracing healthy decadence by being enthused by life, and establishing a deep affinity with both masculine and feminine energy and the primordial powers that have existed since ancient times. We become Chimeric transfigurations when we encourage the full archetypal spectrum of the feminine, cultivating a visceral and intuitive connection to this world and the elemental spirits of the earth through sensory perception, which is a revolt against Materialism, in favor of animism, the spirit in all things, capturing dreams and fantasy, and beginning to thrive and be of service to ourselves and others.

     Odilon Redon was born on the 20th of April 1840 in Bordeaux, Aquitaine. In 1864 he studied painting in Paris, and later in Bordeau, he took up sculpting as well as instruction in etching and lithography with the engraver Rodolphe Bresdin. In 1870 Redon was drafted to serve in the army in the Franco-Prussian War. After the war, he moved to Paris and created works primarily in charcoal and lithography, producing his Noirs of rich, velvety blacks and luminous whites. Redon regarded the color black as “an agent of the spirit far more than the fine color of the palette or the prism.” 

     Fairly unknown in fin-de-siècle Paris, Redon hadn’t yet become a celebrated figure until 1878 when he gained critical attention with his print Guardian Spirit of the Waters, and in 1879, with the publication of Dans le Rêve, his first album of lithographs. In 1884 he shot to fame when his drawings were celebrated in the brilliant cult novel of Decadence À rebours. (Against Nature) by Joris-Karl Huysmans. During the 1890s, Redon was very much inspired by the literary works of Charles Baudelaire, Edgar Allan Poe, and Huysmans, and he was a regular among the artists and writers who gathered at Symbolist poet Stéphane Mallarmé's home and salon. After 1900 he produced work in pastel and oils, abandoning his Noirs for the colors of the prism, and his chimeras were now chromatic.

     In 1903 the French government gave Odilon Redon the Legion of Honor. He continued to exhibit widely. 1916 was the year of his passing.

     Late nineteenth-century Symbolism was a literary movement and new manifestation in Art following heroic Romanticism, whose French, Russian, and Belgian artists rallied against humdrum Realism, puerile Naturalism, and an Impressionism they felt didn’t rouse the imagination. At the close of the century, Charles Baudelaire, Stéphane Mallarmé, Arthur Rimbaud, Paul Valéry, Joris Karl Huysmans, and Paul Verlaine affirmed the symbolist conception in literature and poetry, while Gustave Moreau, Odilon Redon, Félicien Rops, Jean Delville, Jan Toorop, Fernand Khnopff, Aubrey Beardsley, Pierre Puvis de Chavannes, and others, became the art movement’s nexus of visionaries.

     In Symbolism these artists saw a new outlook that opposed the rise of science, was a reaction against mediocrity and exalted the spiritual over the material while finding refuge in fantasy and medieval and Renaissance symbolism. The Symbolist was a loner-artist, outside of society, they followed the desires of their hearts and minds, creating art through expressions of intuition, imagination, the Ideal, melancholy, decadence, myth, dream, mysticism, the occult, and the otherworldly — all qualities that inspired twentieth-century Surrealists thirty years later.

     TAROT CHIMERA card art is edge-to-edge in color. Keeping to the integrity of Odilon Redon’s vision, I have digitally enhanced his artwork due to the fact that the files straight from the museum archives and libraries were not of optimum photo quality. I have optimized their contrast, line quality, sharpness, saturation, hues and tones, while coaxing the chiaroscuro light even more. Most of the cards were sourced from Redon’s black and white “Noir” collection. However, a few of the artworks originally in color I have turned into warm and cool duotones to match the overall feel of the deck. 

     To ensure they are a better fit for the tarot card symbolism and meaning, I have altered by collaging 10 of the 78 cards, using ONLY Redon’s original imagery, (I have put a star asterisk in the Companion Book next to those cards to signify where creative collaging has been done.)

     With the 7 of Pentacles card, Redon depicted a large dice seeming to grow on a plant-like structure. I added a few more dice and more stems and leaves to mimic the traditional Rider-Waite-Smith depiction of seven Pentacles growing on a bush:

     With the Temperance card, I wanted to depict the Angel holding two incense censers much like the R-W-S angel who holds the two cups, so in Photoshop I collaged in an extra censor and a hand holding it:

     The Odilon Redon prints have been sourced from museum photographs and scans that have been made available to the public domain (often in low resolution). Most were very obscure in dark tones and blurry, and I worked hard to enhance the contrast, black line quality, and sharpness to all. Here is an example of one of the original museum scans that I designed as the Death card. You can see the original is dark and the horse is barely visible. I did my best to enhance Redon’s artwork from their original, not-so-perfect scans. I feel they all turned out great and hope you do too!

     

     The Tuck Box will be printed on matte premium cardstock. If the Stretch Goals are reached, the Tuck Box will have Gold Foil Embossed designs and will be sealed with a custom-designed First Edition Stamp.

 

stamp enlarged to show detail

 

     The Keywords Mini booklet comes with each deck and will fit in the Tuck Box. (Note: the mini Booklet does not contain the chimeric interpretations that the Arcana of Odilon Redon Companion Guidebook offers, but is useful for those who like to know quick keywords to guide their personal readings.)

     A 200-page, First Edition book (5.5 × 8.5 in) in color, featuring the 78 original-size tarot cards opposite full-page tarot interpretations from the “chimeric” perspective.

Available as: Softcover Print Book or PDF eBook

     I have an MFA in Creative Writing, non-fiction, fiction, and poetry. My background is in design, publishing, editing, and research. Writing the Arcana of Odilon Redon Companion Book has been an incredible experience of connecting with the spirit of Redon's imagination, dreams, symbols, archetypes, and mysteries, and personally downloading the “chimeric” mythos to share his Arcana with you.

the book images are mockups, the book layout will be similar, but the book's final look may be subject to change

     The Companion Book is strongly recommended to incorporate into your tarot divination practice working with the 78 cards of the TAROT CHIMERA deck. The “chimeric” interpretations I have written are inspired by the energies from the numinous realm of spirit, encouraging the integration of the shadow for growth and transformation. They bare an invitation to dive deeper into the transformative divination process, with the intention to shed luminous light onto your path, transmute negative energies, foster positive expansive realities, revealing the occulted aspects of self that are shrouded in darkness or hiding beneath the surface that need healing, or alternatively would benefit from being consciously acknowledged and bravely expressed. The interpretations have a touch of the poetic; they are serious or playful where relevant, and always strive to be insightful and helpful.

The Companion Book includes:

78 Odilon Redon full-size Tarot cards in color

Plus an additional 10 Oracle cards

full page Tarot card interpretations

a brief history of fin de siècle 19th-century Symbolist art

a biography of Odilon Redon

a graphic of traditional Tarot card spreads

suggestions on how to magically consecrate your Tarot deck

alternate artwork that never made the final Tarot deck

an appendix of titles of Redon’s original lithographs and paintings used in the deck

A sample page from the 5.5" x 8.5" Companion Guidebook:

TIMELINE:

     Legends Playing Card Company, LPCC, already have all my files for the Deck and Tuck Box. They will begin printing once the campaign funding is in. I do not foresee any concerns with delays, except potentially pandemic-related (see Risks and Challenges). Printing overseas is normally a 12-week print turnaround to get from them to me. And then I will ship out to the world. International orders may arrive in January rather than December due to customs processes.)

 October - November Printing the deck and guidebook / manufacturing rewards

 December (and possibly January depending on your location): Shipping the decks and books to me, and then from me to backers. Expect the months of December and January for shipping to you, (I expect that most backers will receive their decks before the holidays, but it is not guaranteed.) 

SHIPPING: PLEASE READ:

        Shipping will be charged separately. Shipping prices include the cost to ship plus the packaging supplies purchased to ship them. With you covering the shipping costs for your deck and rewards this project is made possible. Thank you!

I will bubble wrap your pledge items to keep them in-tact. Any packages that are lost in transit, I can't be held responsible for once they ship, but I am willing to look at a case-by-case basis in accordance with the tracking info provided by USPS. A domestic package is not considered "lost" until 15 business days after the day it was shipped. An international package is not considered "lost" until 4-8 weeks after the day it was shipped. No replacements will be made if the item is "marked delivered" by USPS at the address you provided. If your reward arrives damaged, please photograph it and contact me so we can file the insurance claim.  Any packages that are returned in good condition can be refunded minus the shipping. No replacements will be made 60 days after the ship date.

 

CDT:

     If you live outside of the United States, it’s possible that you may be charged Customs costs, Duties and Taxes (CDT) are the backers’ responsibility, and will NOT be included in the shipping price. The full customs value of your package will be indicated as required by international rules. Please notice that import tax rates vary by country, and your order may be subject to import tax or VAT. Please check your country’s regulations for CDT and relevant tax rates). If for any reason Customs keep your package and does not return it to us, unfortunately, the order is non-refundable. If customs returns the deck to me, I will refund you the cost of the deck.

 

The Creator: 

 I have experience with custom orders, small-scale manufacturing, customer service, and fulfillment/shipping from having run three businesses over the past 20 years. I understand the need for delivering a quality product, represented accurately and shipped on time. I have a background in printmaking, book arts, teaching Photoshop, and publishing small press journals. In Ireland, I ran a pottery called Terra Lucida. From 2003-07, I was the creator, publisher, editor, and designer of the New England publication Inner Tapestry. From 2012-2017, I ran a handmade textiles business: “Reverie Textiles” modern cashmere homewares. I produced over 700 luxury cashmere blankets, pillows, hats, and scarves and I shipped all over the world. I feel confident in my experience and capacity from these businesses, which will aid me in fulfilling your rewards for this campaign in a timely, professional and communicative manner.  Here is my BLOG: Synthemata & Symbola

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

Notes for Buyers

     Please be sure to read the Shipping Information in the above section. And please make sure you have an up-to-date debit or credit card. Please double-check when typing in your address for accuracy so your deck arrives just as it should and doesn’t get returned to sender.

Thank You!

     Deep gratitude to everyone! I hope TAROT CHIMERA brings you joy and more connection to the spirit realm! It has been an honor to work with Redon’s art and spend time hanging out in his dark and illuminated, beguiling world. To all who have helped to support this project: I’m ever grateful! Please keep in touch and follow me on social media to be aware of the future projects that I am looking forward to revealing in the coming months!

— Nitasia
story_txt: WELCOME! I’m Nitasia Roland ~ I am a writer, poet, artist, independent researcher, and publisher of esoterica. I work in a design studio I founded called Urania Press. I have curated and designed TAROT CHIMERA, bringing the beguiling Symbolist art of Odilon Redon to contemporary Tarot. The deck is interpreted from a “chimeric” perspective, encouraging transformation through art and divination, deepening our connection to our dark and light identities, dreams, mysteries, and the realms of spirit. Chimeras are creatures of the imagination that carry dreamers away.     As an animist, it is my philosophy that everything in this world is imbibed with a spirit. I believe the 19th-century French lithographer, painter, and pastellist Odilon Redon knew this on a profound level and sought to invoke chimeric spirit into all his sublime visions, turning his solitude, dream-filled imagination, and weird and uncanny intrigues into art.     In 2020 I was called to curate and digitally enhance Redon’s art (that is over 140 years old) aligning it to the Major and Minor Arcana. I interpreted the cards in the style of the traditional Rider-Waite-Smith system, and I chose in some instances to depict cards with gender-neutral characters and non-heterosexual couples. I have also designed 10 additional Oracle cards as part of the campaign’s Stretch Goals, which will make a total of 88 cards.     TAROT CHIMERA is a divination tool for self-knowledge that allows its user to tap into a unique chimeric nature through the boundless imagination and universal mysteries of what I call Odilon Redon’s “Arcana”: his dark, mystical and magical archetypes and symbols, with the intention to shed luminous light onto our path, face personal demons, transmute negative energies, foster expansive realities, revealing the hidden aspects of self that need transforming or alternatively would benefit from being acknowledged and bravely expressed.                          As an undergrad for my Bachelor of Fine Arts degree, I worked in the Art library and discovered a magnificent book by Philippe Jullian called Dreamers of Decadence about the Symbolist artists of the fin de siècle 1890s. The book’s overarching theme is that of the Chimera, no longer a hybrid monster of Classical myth, but an archetype of the Symbolist’s manifesto of metaphorical and symbolic imagery and mystical and hermetic ideals, created as reactions against rationalism and matter-of-fact realism. Symbolist works of art and literature elevate the elemental and sublime in nature, the mystique of the feminine, symbolic dreams, the occulted subconscious, decadence, Romantic ideals, and the fantastic vagaries of the imagination. I loved the paintings and prints by Fernand Khnopff, Gustave Moreau, and Jean Delville, which appealed to my Gothic sensibilities. In particular, I felt a personal affinity with the artist Odilon Redon (1840-1916).      Redon’s prints, particularly his collection called Noirs, were dark and uncanny, and steeped in the otherworldly. Alfred Werner, the writer of The Graphic Works of Odilon Redon explains: “Art enabled him to channel the demoniacal forces from the depths of his self into well-integrated, well-designed images that, despite their astounding aspects, console and comfort with an amazingly soothing lucidity.” It was this aspect to Redon's artwork that left a lasting impression on me.     While being home due to Covid, I stumbled across an old journal where I had pasted Xeroxed copies of Redon’s prints and noticed one image that resonated as ideal for the Tower card in the Tarot deck. I did a Google search and discovered much of Odilon Redon’s artwork was in the Public Domain. For all of 2020, I searched museum archives matching Redon’s enigmatic imagery to the Tarot. The cards fell into the Arcana so perfectly it was as if Redon’s spirit was giving me the “go-ahead” to bring his work into the divination context. TAROT CHIMERA was born. After six months of searching for just the right fit, digitally enhancing in Photoshop around 100 Redon images, repairing poor quality museum scans in need of repair, and adjusting the final 78 (plus 10 Oracles) to the Tarot card format, I then began the second phase of this project: composing a Companion Guidebook interpreting the deck from a “chimeric” mythos and perspective. “I must also have a dark side if I am to be whole.”  – Carl G. Jung      The Arcana of Odilon Redon seeks the ancient paths of sympathetic magic and dreams in order to find the balance between the conscious and the subconscious levels to reframe difficulties and channel beneficial forces for growth and transformation. It is a meditation tool for unlocking personal truth through myth and the metaphysical, symbolism, acknowledging the value of the shadow, and intuition.         Through self-awareness and looking deep within, interacting with the chimeric nature of a given situation has the potential to help the querent navigate aspects of the darker expressions of self. Through honing in on the chimeric within a given thought, action, or experience, a conversation can arise and beneficial information can be attained. Perhaps banishments of trickster spirits are in order, or, alternatively, there may be alliances ready to be made for positive outcomes.      A true visionary, Odilon Redon, from the inner depths of psyche, dream, and the unconscious, rendered deep shadow and luminous light (tenebroso and chiaroscuro) into an assortment of mysterious beings and unknown forces: mystical figures of the ancient world, ancestral apparitions, charmed objects, hybrid figures (chimeras), phantoms, amorphous microbes and bacteria, disembodied heads, winged-beasts, angels, Sun gods, Buddhas, cyclops, sphinx, spiders, snakes, skulls, skeletons, dice, sentient flora and monstrous fauna, martyrs wearing crowns of thorns, shining stars and luminaries, and eyeballs floating as hot-air balloons.     When drawing a single TAROT CHIMERA card, or laying out a spread, it is hoped that an affinity is inspired by Redon’s enigmatic visions and that the querent will find the chimerae charming and soothing, relevant, divinatory, and transformative, while placing, as the Symbolist artist explained of his work, “the logic of the visible in the service of the invisible.” 78 Large Tarot Cards: 22 Major Arcana Cards and 56 Minor Arcana CardsDimensions: 75mm x 130mm (2.95 inches x 5.12 inches)Printed on heavy, casino-quality Playing Card stock with an embossed Linen finish, assuring easy shuffle and wear resistanceKeywords Mini Booklet (fits in Tuck Box)Beautiful Tuck Box printed on matte premium cardstock Manufactured by Legends Playing Card Company LPCCEmbossing and Gold Foil designs on Tuck BoxDesigner “First Edition” Tuck Box Stamp Seal  10 Oracle Cards (The "Visionary" Oracle is designed as a Urania Press brand card.) Note: the Companion Guidebook has in-depth interpretations matching each of the 78 cards and the 10 Oracles, aligning them to the Rider-Waite-Smith system.MAJOR ARCANA ~MINOR ARCANA ~Suit of Wands:Suit of Cups:Suit of Swords:Suit of Pentacles:The additional 10 ORACLE Cards:Chimeric beings are nature spirits in every way      The charming card back is a double-ended format designed from Odilon Redon’s print "Perversité" (1891). Isn’t she alluring with her coy, over-the-shoulder glance! What secrets will she be whispering as you shuffle through your TAROT CHIMERA cards?The Chimera is a mythic hybrid creature of antiquity depicted with the body of a lion, with both a goat and lion’s head and a serpent’s tail. It is a creature of strength and cunning representing a symbolic and mystic connection with wild feminine energy. The Chimera is a conduit of fantastic dreams that can be embodied and cultivated within. Ambiguous, baneful, and seraphic, its form is both attractive and repulsive: “she is a promise of the Ideal, with the body of a carnivorous beast,” explained the French Symbolist painter Gustave Moreau.     The word “chimera” comes from the Greek meaning “she-goat.” In the Middle Ages, the Chimera was considered an ill omen of natural disasters and came to symbolize toxic views of women as “wicked.” A more enlightened contemporary conception understands the Chimera as the reconciliation of both the bold and brazen aspects of the feminine: (passionate and seductive, femme fatale, links with the underworld, mystery, intuition, the subconscious, drawn to temptation, perversity, liberation, impulsive, willful, and capricious), integrated with the aspects of the feminine that embody the personification of nature, love and beauty, nurture, sensuality, sympathy, generosity, and kindness.Classical conceptions of the Chimera:19th Century Symbolist Chimeras:      The 19th century fin de siècle Symbolist artists exalted the Chimera. They painted Les Chimères in many imaginative variants, evoked from the inner depths of dream and the unconscious. A plethora of numinous and liminal forces, untamable creatures, delightful follies, melancholic beauties, tricksters, spirits, entities, and beasts: winged horses, unicorns, satyrs, sphinx, angels, merfolk, gods and goddesses, sentient plants, disembodied heads, ancestral apparitions, and delightfully capricious bacteria.     The key to embodying the Chimera is non-repression of the senses, embracing healthy decadence by being enthused by life, and establishing a deep affinity with both masculine and feminine energy and the primordial powers that have existed since ancient times. We become Chimeric transfigurations when we encourage the full archetypal spectrum of the feminine, cultivating a visceral and intuitive connection to this world and the elemental spirits of the earth through sensory perception, which is a revolt against Materialism, in favor of animism, the spirit in all things, capturing dreams and fantasy, and beginning to thrive and be of service to ourselves and others.     Odilon Redon was born on the 20th of April 1840 in Bordeaux, Aquitaine. In 1864 he studied painting in Paris, and later in Bordeau, he took up sculpting as well as instruction in etching and lithography with the engraver Rodolphe Bresdin. In 1870 Redon was drafted to serve in the army in the Franco-Prussian War. After the war, he moved to Paris and created works primarily in charcoal and lithography, producing his Noirs of rich, velvety blacks and luminous whites. Redon regarded the color black as “an agent of the spirit far more than the fine color of the palette or the prism.”      Fairly unknown in fin-de-siècle Paris, Redon hadn’t yet become a celebrated figure until 1878 when he gained critical attention with his print Guardian Spirit of the Waters, and in 1879, with the publication of Dans le Rêve, his first album of lithographs. In 1884 he shot to fame when his drawings were celebrated in the brilliant cult novel of Decadence À rebours. (Against Nature) by Joris-Karl Huysmans. During the 1890s, Redon was very much inspired by the literary works of Charles Baudelaire, Edgar Allan Poe, and Huysmans, and he was a regular among the artists and writers who gathered at Symbolist poet Stéphane Mallarmé's home and salon. After 1900 he produced work in pastel and oils, abandoning his Noirs for the colors of the prism, and his chimeras were now chromatic.     In 1903 the French government gave Odilon Redon the Legion of Honor. He continued to exhibit widely. 1916 was the year of his passing.     Late nineteenth-century Symbolism was a literary movement and new manifestation in Art following heroic Romanticism, whose French, Russian, and Belgian artists rallied against humdrum Realism, puerile Naturalism, and an Impressionism they felt didn’t rouse the imagination. At the close of the century, Charles Baudelaire, Stéphane Mallarmé, Arthur Rimbaud, Paul Valéry, Joris Karl Huysmans, and Paul Verlaine affirmed the symbolist conception in literature and poetry, while Gustave Moreau, Odilon Redon, Félicien Rops, Jean Delville, Jan Toorop, Fernand Khnopff, Aubrey Beardsley, Pierre Puvis de Chavannes, and others, became the art movement’s nexus of visionaries.     In Symbolism these artists saw a new outlook that opposed the rise of science, was a reaction against mediocrity and exalted the spiritual over the material while finding refuge in fantasy and medieval and Renaissance symbolism. The Symbolist was a loner-artist, outside of society, they followed the desires of their hearts and minds, creating art through expressions of intuition, imagination, the Ideal, melancholy, decadence, myth, dream, mysticism, the occult, and the otherworldly — all qualities that inspired twentieth-century Surrealists thirty years later.     TAROT CHIMERA card art is edge-to-edge in color. Keeping to the integrity of Odilon Redon’s vision, I have digitally enhanced his artwork due to the fact that the files straight from the museum archives and libraries were not of optimum photo quality. I have optimized their contrast, line quality, sharpness, saturation, hues and tones, while coaxing the chiaroscuro light even more. Most of the cards were sourced from Redon’s black and white “Noir” collection. However, a few of the artworks originally in color I have turned into warm and cool duotones to match the overall feel of the deck.      To ensure they are a better fit for the tarot card symbolism and meaning, I have altered by collaging 10 of the 78 cards, using ONLY Redon’s original imagery, (I have put a star asterisk in the Companion Book next to those cards to signify where creative collaging has been done.)     With the 7 of Pentacles card, Redon depicted a large dice seeming to grow on a plant-like structure. I added a few more dice and more stems and leaves to mimic the traditional Rider-Waite-Smith depiction of seven Pentacles growing on a bush:     With the Temperance card, I wanted to depict the Angel holding two incense censers much like the R-W-S angel who holds the two cups, so in Photoshop I collaged in an extra censor and a hand holding it:     The Odilon Redon prints have been sourced from museum photographs and scans that have been made available to the public domain (often in low resolution). Most were very obscure in dark tones and blurry, and I worked hard to enhance the contrast, black line quality, and sharpness to all. Here is an example of one of the original museum scans that I designed as the Death card. You can see the original is dark and the horse is barely visible. I did my best to enhance Redon’s artwork from their original, not-so-perfect scans. I feel they all turned out great and hope you do too!          The Tuck Box will be printed on matte premium cardstock. If the Stretch Goals are reached, the Tuck Box will have Gold Foil Embossed designs and will be sealed with a custom-designed First Edition Stamp. stamp enlarged to show detail      The Keywords Mini booklet comes with each deck and will fit in the Tuck Box. (Note: the mini Booklet does not contain the chimeric interpretations that the Arcana of Odilon Redon Companion Guidebook offers, but is useful for those who like to know quick keywords to guide their personal readings.)     A 200-page, First Edition book (5.5 × 8.5 in) in color, featuring the 78 original-size tarot cards opposite full-page tarot interpretations from the “chimeric” perspective.Available as: Softcover Print Book or PDF eBook     I have an MFA in Creative Writing, non-fiction, fiction, and poetry. My background is in design, publishing, editing, and research. Writing the Arcana of Odilon Redon Companion Book has been an incredible experience of connecting with the spirit of Redon's imagination, dreams, symbols, archetypes, and mysteries, and personally downloading the “chimeric” mythos to share his Arcana with you.the book images are mockups, the book layout will be similar, but the book's final look may be subject to change     The Companion Book is strongly recommended to incorporate into your tarot divination practice working with the 78 cards of the TAROT CHIMERA deck. The “chimeric” interpretations I have written are inspired by the energies from the numinous realm of spirit, encouraging the integration of the shadow for growth and transformation. They bare an invitation to dive deeper into the transformative divination process, with the intention to shed luminous light onto your path, transmute negative energies, foster positive expansive realities, revealing the occulted aspects of self that are shrouded in darkness or hiding beneath the surface that need healing, or alternatively would benefit from being consciously acknowledged and bravely expressed. The interpretations have a touch of the poetic; they are serious or playful where relevant, and always strive to be insightful and helpful.The Companion Book includes:78 Odilon Redon full-size Tarot cards in colorPlus an additional 10 Oracle cardsfull page Tarot card interpretationsa brief history of fin de siècle 19th-century Symbolist arta biography of Odilon Redona graphic of traditional Tarot card spreadssuggestions on how to magically consecrate your Tarot deckalternate artwork that never made the final Tarot deckan appendix of titles of Redon’s original lithographs and paintings used in the deckA sample page from the 5.5" x 8.5" Companion Guidebook:TIMELINE:     Legends Playing Card Company, LPCC, already have all my files for the Deck and Tuck Box. They will begin printing once the campaign funding is in. I do not foresee any concerns with delays, except potentially pandemic-related (see Risks and Challenges). Printing overseas is normally a 12-week print turnaround to get from them to me. And then I will ship out to the world. International orders may arrive in January rather than December due to customs processes.) October - November Printing the deck and guidebook / manufacturing rewards December (and possibly January depending on your location): Shipping the decks and books to me, and then from me to backers. story:
OUR STORY

The epidemic began affecting dogs by the thousands overseas. Soon, canines around the world were being exposed and before long, the night air was filled with sounds from beyond. Ordinary pets were transformed into werewolves--barking at the moon and scaring the neighbor's kids...This is our story:


An Internet Sensation

Pictures began surfacing on the Internet of this strange phenomena...canines transformed from man's best friend to killer beasts with razor sharp fangs. Before long, people all over the country began to take notice. What was an occasional post here or there soon became a viral sensation. Now, there's no stopping the werewolf dogs!

From Russia With Love

The original werewolf MuzzleMasks are designed and hand-made in Moscow, Russia. They are crafted from the finest materials and designed for the maximum comfort of your pet. These MuzzleMasks come in 5 sizes, designed to fit any dog from a Poodle to a Great Dane. MuzzleMasks provide plenty of room for your pet to open their jaw and are created for your dog to make the ultimate bad boy or vicious girl statement!

Maximum Effect for ALL dogs!

Designed for Maximum Comfort

Sure--they look viscous--but the Original Werewolf MuzzleMask is made from premium materials designed with your dog's comfort in mind, including non-toxic plastic and a leather insert. MuzzleMasks are light and durable, and feature a nylon strap with a plastic buckle for a sturdy fit--they are absolutely harmless to your pet.  There is plenty of room for your beast to open and close his/her jaws and stick out his/her tongue.


What We Need & What You Get

The Original Werewolf MuzzleMask is hand-made in Russia.  Demand in the United States is growing, but up until now, there has not been a way to effectively distribute them in this country.  That's where you come in.  By helping to meet our all-or-nothing campaign, not only will you help provide the funding required to import the initial supply of MuzzleMasks, but you will also be able to get one (or more!) at a discounted price.

Valya displaying MuzzleMasks at a trade show in Moscow

Challenges?

The biggest challenges to this venture are logistical.  We have a shipping company in place and a centrally located US warehouse to hold and distribute all orders quickly and efficiently.  That being said, the product is being shipped from Russia and there is always a chance that delays can occur along the way--clearing US customs, for example.

If this campaign goes hugely viral, then there is also a chance we may have a delay in catching up on production of the muzzles.  This is something we have discussed with our counterparts in Russia and we feel as though we have contingencies in place to address this. 

That being said, we do not anticipate any serious logistical problems and look forward to transforming pets all over the country very soon!


Other Ways You Can Help

Speaking of going viral--we really hope it does! That would be a great thing, and we would love you to take a second now to use the Indiegogo share tools to share campaign with them!

his/her tongue.


   





High quality, Exceptional Detail, and Maximum Comfort




What We Need & What You GetThe Original Werewolf MuzzleMask is hand-made in Russia.  Demand in the United States is growing, but up until now, there has not been a way to effectively distribute them in this country.  That's where you come in.  By helping to meet our all-or-nothing campaign, not only will you help provide the funding required to import the initial supply of MuzzleMasks, but you will also be able to get one (or more!) at a discounted price.
 Valya displaying MuzzleMasks at a trade show in Moscow 
Challenges?The biggest challenges to this venture are logistical.  We have a shipping company in place and a centrally located US warehouse to hold and distribute all orders quickly and efficiently.  That being said, the product is being shipped from Russia and there is always a chance that delays can occur along the way--clearing US customs, for example. If this campaign goes hugely viral, then there is also a chance we may have a delay in catching up on production of the muzzles.  This is something we have discussed with our counterparts in Russia and we feel as though we have contingencies in place to address this.  That being said, we do not anticipate any serious logistical problems 
and look forward to transforming pets all over the country very soon!
Other Ways You Can HelpSpeaking of going viral--we really hope it does! That would be a great 
thing, and we would love you to take a second now to use the Indiegogo share tools to share campaign with them!

story:
My name is Lucia and I am artist

 

 I live and create in small town called Michalovce in Slovakia. Architecture, town’s scenery and life of inanimate things are subjects that I am often focused on. People can say that my paintings could tell stories. I also prefer mix building motion, dynamics and dancing. Towns, sceneries and human beings are very inspirational to me. I have participated in a number of solo and group exhibitions at Slovakia and abroad.

I want to show people places where they live in modern and fun way and to enrich their cultural and social life.

This is my dream project, please help me bring it to life!

Now I have only Coloring book of Bratislava (Capital city of Slovakia) but I am working on other cities and towns in the world right now.

What We Need & What You Get

I am going to use raised money for printing and marketing to show people what i create.

Even if i don't reach my entire goal, i will use that money for printing.

The Impact

My coloring books are educational. They are for kids and even adults. You can get to know new cities you had not known about.

Other Ways You Can Help

It would be very helpful if you share it with your friends on social media and tell your friends :).

You can also help me with printing these books.

Thanks for your help :)

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
THE PROJECT

As an animal lover I am proud to call Perth in Western Australia my home. I feel so fortunate to be able to drive only a short distance to be amongst native flora and fauna some would only see in books or film.

Almost 550 species of birds have been recorded in Western Australia. 387 species have been recorded breeding. 17 species are endemic to Western Australia. These are Carnaby's Black-Cockatoo, Baudin's Black-Cockatoo, Western Corella, Western Rosella, Red-capped Parrot, Noisy Scrub-bird, Red-winged Fairy-wren, Black Grasswren, Western Bristlebird, Dusky Gerygone, Western Thornbill, Western Wattlebird, Kimberley Honeyeater, Western Spinebill, White-breasted Robin, Western Ground Parrot and Red-eared Firetail. - Information supplied by Birdlife Australia.

A short time ago I was made aware of the current situation of the Western Ground Parrot. There are fewer than 150 of these birds left on our planet. These birds may no longer be around in the not so distant future. I began thinking about how I could possibly use my skills as an artist to help people become aware of the birds that are special to certain areas of Western Australia. If I could paint a mural of a bird on a wall close to where it is located than maybe people will start to take notice. If they were aware of it, maybe they would want to learn more about the species. If they learn more about the species maybe then they would realise how lucky we are to have a bird found nowhere else in Australia but our state.

I would like to think that in 100 years time we will still have all 17 of our endemic birds alive and well in their natural habitat....but we just don't know.

 

THE PROCESS

I will be collaborating with Western Australian photographers to create the murals I will be painting. The photographer will take a photo of the bird in the area it is known to frequent. I will then use the photograph as reference and, in my style, create a mural on the closest possible wall surface. Below the mural will be the name of the bird, the location, the photographer and my website. I am hoping that, with this project, I can share the special experience of collaborating with photographers and possibly create future possibilities for them by sharing their name. Each mural will be covered from start to finish on my website blog.

 

THE FIRST MURAL

To give you all a better idea of the project here is the first mural of the project which I completed at the start of July. The bird chosen was the Western Spinebill which was photographed by Gary Meredith in the Dryandra Woodlands near Narrogin.

Photo of Western Spinebill taken by Gary Meredith

Concept created on Photoshop with Gary's photo

Lions Village, Dryandra mural location (within 1km from where photo was taken)

The finished mural

WITH YOUR HELP

Your contributions to my fundraiser will help get the first 6 murals of the project completed.

The money you help raise will pay for my artist rate, travel needed to reach locations, paint and materials and payment for the photographers.

With your help we can all educate the people of western Australia about the special birds we share our environment with.

story:
Get a 20% refund on any pledge via PayPal or bank transfer after campaign ends if you join as a member of BackerCity.

http://backercity.com/

 

Short Summary

My name is Patrick Brooks and I am a children's book illustrator and writer. www.psbrooks.com

Here are some of the books I have worked on:  

 

Having used mindfulness as a technique for dealing with stress, my idea was to create a series of badges that might encourage a more positive outlook and get people interested in trying meditation, or appeal to those who already use it. As a fan of Lovecraft, I thought Cthulhu would be a fun and unusual character to try to convey the importance of trying to relax. I hope it will appeal to Lovecraft fans and will make people smile. The badges will be 38mm. 

 

Badge 1: Focus on the present. You are awesome!

 

 

Badge 2: Breathe calmly. Let go of negativity.

 

 

Badge 3: Be kind to yourself and the world.

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

The target is £600 to cover the cost of manufacturing and posting 3 x 50 badges. 

 

This is a flexible goal and if the project doesn't reach the target:

At £200 badge #1 will be manufactured and posted 

At £400 badge #2 will also be manufactured and posted

 

An example: If backers pledge on three badges (£16) and the project only reaches £200 to unlock the first badge, then the backer will only pay the cost of 1 badge (£6) and will be refunded the rest.  If the project doesn't reach £200, then no badges will be made.

Other Crowdfunding projects:

 

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/psbrooks/d...

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/psbrooks/g...

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/psbrooks/t...

 

POSTAGE OPTIONS: 

If you would prefer to use tracked and signed post, please increase your pledge by £5 and see the FAQ. 

 

Here is a list of the perks:

 

Other Books in Perks

DREAMS - a 100 page short story art book

 

THE DEFINITIVE FELINE GUIDE TO HATS - a collection of illustrations inspired by cats up for adoption.

 

THE MAGIC ACCORDION - a story about a pirate girl and her cat who gain super powers.

 

GOOSE VS MOOSE - a story about rivalry and teamwork.

 

The Impact

I hope the badges will encourage mindfulness, meditation, finding calm in the stress, anxiety and negativity of life sometimes, will be a fun item for people to own and get more interested in the work of Lovecraft.    

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The artwork is complete and ready to be sent to be manufactured. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any shares on social media would be much appreciated.

story:
Connecting workspace for compassion, reformation, and newness. 

Project Transformations is the inaugural project ran by Dr Tuuli Bell and Elizabeth Jenner for the Sister Sister Network and Arise 2020.

Using traditional painting and drawing methods this project will invite the attendees of Arise 2020 to sit alongside sculptural works and create free hand drawings. Opening a creative dialogue, in a task that some may have never experienced. These creations will be collected and documented by Tuuli and Elizabeth, reimagined and transformed into a singular, collaborative piece.

What to expect from Project Transformations at Arise 2020

ARISE Summit 2020, a 200-attendee conference organised by the Reading-based Sister Sister Network, which is a Women’s Leadership Network launched in 2013. 

At ARISE 2020, we are situated after the registration desk, so that those who arrive early can have a connecting experience with other guests from the very start of the day. The guests can take inspiration from sculptures situated in the middle of the space, and draw their interpretations, on paper. Once they are finished they can throw their work into the sculptures bases; and enter the main conference feeling creatively renewed. The workshop is a great way for people with different backgrounds to become equals; a safe space to break the ice and start communicating with other conference participants.

Towards the end of the conference, a digital image created using the participants work, curated by Elizabeth and Tuuli will be shown through a projection. A story of the days conversations is read as the projected image enters the stage.

By transforming the initial works of the participants, we use this visual metaphor, to highlight the importance of conversation and collaboration at Arise 2020. 

On the day there will be a cohort of volunteers to assist with co-ordination, materials and information for the project.

Project Transformation is available for all conference participants. Book your Arise 2020 conference tickets at https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/arise-womens-sum....

story:
Hello,

My name is Nibras and I retired recently. Now that I have retired, I want to fulfil a long-time ambition to study ceramics. I am proud that I was offered a place on the BA ceramic design course at Central Saint Martins college in London (I didn’t think I can make it to CSM). I had to submit a portfolio of art work for the application. It wasn't an easy task after working in a technical field for a long time. Luckily it was a success. However, I have to find £9,250 to pay the annual fees in order to take my place on the course. This is where I need your help as I don’t qualify for a grant or a student loan. Before I retired, I worked in IT. IT is a creative and interesting field, but I now need to work with my hands and produce three dimensional objects. I was at an interview for a ceramic course and the interviewer asked me what I did; when I replied I worked in IT she said, well then you need to muck in. So I need to muck in and get my hand dirty.

I want to prove that it is never too late to go back to education and learn a new skill. If you have the passion you can do it.

To Say Thank You for Supporting Me.

I enjoy gardening and taking photographs. I like to combine them in my work. I created a garden that I and my neighbours can enjoy. All the photographs in these pieces of work are from my garden. If you like to support my campaign please choose from the perks I am offering.

Please choose from the following art work for the perks: Thriving Supporter, Budding Supporter, Budding Supporter, Growing Supporter, Flourishing supporter, Blooming supporter, Tender Supporter and Mug shots.

story:
Who’s this guy ?

My name is Philippe Halaburda, 43, a french painter. I began my artistic career since around 15 years while continuing my graphic designer.

I have exhibited a lot in France and Europe without being able to break through as I wanted but since 3 years, early recognition came from the Santa Fe, New Mexico, US.

There are 6 months ago, I made the bet to quit my job to dedicate myself 100% in my art and so give me the best chance to succeed.

The doors are opened in the US !

So I tried to include artist residencies in the States to continue to work my art: one of them, the NARS FOUNDATION INTERNATIONAL RESIDENCY based in Brooklyn, has selected me for this spring by giving to me  a studio for 3 months .

I and really want to the chance to live this new experience and I broke my piggy bank, counted and recounted my dollars, I miss some ... .dollars!


Please, I need your help to develop my innovating art project!

This is an important step in my career, I really need your support! Without you, I could not go, and I am less than 2 months of departure.

Working in New York will bring new ideas in my painting: I developed a "very personal" painting on the theme of mental maps. I create landscapes or cities that do not exist, which are not. Everything comes from my own imagination into a fully rendered abstract. 

Spending three months in the Big Apple is bound to inspire me and cause me to reconsider my painting and my technique. I want to make my art more present, more rooted in the time and New York life looks ideal as a source of new creations. 

The project I would like to develop will mix photo and painting, reality and virtuality. I will include one QR code in each canvas or paper.

For me, the city is a projection on the ground of social relations. Through a personal and original graphic writing, through a completely abstract painting, I try to tell a story, to blend the real life and my own imagination.


The art project on creative and custom QR code

What is a QR code?

The QR code is a kind of bar code consisting of black modules arranged in a white square. The layout of these points defines the information contained in the code and it is customizable. Graphically, this form will blend perfectly with other graphics I already use my pictorial work. In addition, each table will be interactive and will trigger the following:

  • show Geographically New York on Google View for example
  • watch a video online about the city
  • display an original text or citations compared to New York
  • use you own photo of New York (file jpeg that you sent me before by email)
  • listen a specific sound of New York

Explanation of the different steps of work session in New York:

The QR code will take part of my original creation: sizes & colors will be also related to the medium, the subject and theme of the painting. Technically, each QR code will be unique and active.


For even more interactivity with the audience during an exhibition!

Ech original creation will be interactive with this QR code: each people will be able to scan it and will discover the corresponding picture online. 

An exhibition will be organized with all of these works created in New York during or after my residency. 

Similarly, a book will be printed and given to those who have part funded my project. This booklet will be titled "NY: urban morphology"

It's a little each of you that I'm going to take there and it is normal to share this experience with you from start to finish. I promise, if they come to visit me in my studio, I will ask for an autograph or Jennyfer A. Liza M. and sing for you "New York New York".

I need money for:

The funding will be used to pay the fees for the studio in the NARS Foundation. Staying there for this period will cost 5 000 us dollars. I have already confirmed my venue with a first payment of 2 000 us dollars. The remaining funding of the residence is already completed (living expenses, residence, plane, etc.)

Thanks a lot for you help !

Philippe Halaburda

You can find all details about this project online on my personal website.

Click here to visit the NARS FOUNDATION INTERNATIONAL RESIDENCY in NY
story_txt:
Who’s this guy ?
My name is Philippe Halaburda, 43, a french painter. I began my artistic career since around 15 years while continuing my graphic designer.

I have exhibited a lot in France and Europe without being able to break through as I wanted but since 3 years, early recognition came from the Santa Fe, New Mexico, US.

There are 6 months ago, I made the bet to quit my job to dedicate myself 100% in my art and so give me the best chance to succeed. The doors are opened in the US ! So I tried to include artist residencies in the States to continue to work my art: one of them, the NARS FOUNDATION INTERNATIONAL RESIDENCY based in Brooklyn, has selected me for this spring by giving to me  a studio for 3 months .I and really want to the chance to live this new experience and I broke my piggy bank, counted and recounted my dollars, I miss some ... .dollars!Please, I need your help to develop my innovating art project! This is an important step in my career, I really need your support! Without you, I could not go, and I am less than 2 months of departure.Working in New York will bring new ideas in my painting: I developed a "very personal" painting on the theme of mental maps. I create landscapes or cities that do not exist, which are not. Everything comes from my own imagination into a fully rendered abstract. Spending three months in the Big Apple is bound to inspire me and cause me to reconsider my painting and my technique. I want to make my art more present, more rooted in the time and New York life looks ideal as a source of new creations. The project I would like to develop will mix photo and painting, reality and virtuality. I will include one QR code in each canvas or paper.For me, the city is a projection on the ground of social relations. Through a personal and original graphic writing, through a completely abstract painting, I try to tell a story, to blend the real life and my own imagination.The art project on creative and custom QR code
What is a QR code?The QR code is a kind of bar code consisting of black modules arranged in a white square. The layout of these points defines the information contained in the code and it is customizable. Graphically, this form will blend perfectly with other graphics I already use my pictorial work. In addition, each table will be interactive and will trigger the following:

show Geographically New York on Google View for example


watch a video online about the city

display an original text or citations compared to New York
use you own photo of New York (file jpeg that you sent me before by email)
listen a specific sound of New York

Explanation of the different steps of work session in New York:The QR code will take part of my original creation: sizes & colors will be also related to the medium, the subject and theme of the painting. Technically, each QR code will be unique and active.For even more interactivity with the audience during an exhibition!Ech original creation will be interactive with this QR code: each people will be able to scan it and will discover the corresponding picture online. 
An exhibition will be organized with all of these works created in New York during or after my residency. 
Similarly, a book will be printed and given to those who have part funded my project. This booklet will be titled "NY: urban morphology"
It's a little each of you that I'm going to take there and it is normal to share this experience with you from start to finish. I promise, if they come to visit me in my studio, I will ask for an autograph or Jennyfer A. Liza M. and sing for you "New York New York".


I need money for:
The funding will be used to pay the fees for the studio in the NARS Foundation. Staying there for this period will cost 5 000 us dollars. I have already confirmed my venue with a first payment of 2 000 us dollars. The remaining funding of the residence is already completed (living expenses, residence, plane, etc.)
Thanks a lot for you help !
Philippe Halaburda
You can find all details about this project online on my personal website.
Click here to visit the NARS FOUNDATION INTERNATIONAL RESIDENCY in NY

story:
About this image

The first of a proposed series of images by photographer John Laurens - all featuring life studies with iconic VW campervans. Atmospherically captured and tastefully presented, this image centres on a VW Brazilian Bay T2 - one of the last produced in this form. Available as either a fine art print or wall art canvas, this will create both a centre piece and talking point for VW and photography fans everywhere.

What I Need & What You Get

I require a modest amount of backing to put a print run together for this image, and also to help create further images in this collection. As well as printing costs, travel and van hire are all real expenses needing to be met to allow this to happen.

  • Fine Art, quality prints available in a selection of sizes.
  • Canvas prints also available, ready for you to frame or have "gallery wrapped" for a super-modern, eye-catching wall display.
  • Options include FREE world-wide shipping.
  • Choice of colour tones. Choose ANY perk opposite and note your preferred option of the following finishes:
Pure Black & White:


Blue Tone - a subtle, not vibrant, blue wash.


Sepia Tone - a warmer finish.


Copper Tone - a slightly more yellow variation of the sepia tone.


Remember to indicate your preference when ordering - any of the Perks can feature one finish. If your order more than one perk, the finishes can be mixed. You will be contacted if no preference is indicated, and asked to confirm your desired finish.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in this image in a different format, please contact me - I may be able to add it to the list of options.

story:
I'm going to DesignerCon!  I am raising $5000 to cover the cost of inventory production, display supplies, packaging materials, convention fees, artwork frames, and more.

This is a super exciting opporunity for me, but in order to put my best foot forward at the show, I need your help!  Join in on the MADNESS by selecting a perk to the right, or scroll down for more information.

 

According to their website, “DesignerCon is an annual art and design convention that smashes together collectible toys and designer goods with urban, underground and pop art!”

This is such a monumental opportunity for my career!  It is a chance to get my work in front of a plethora of prospective collaborative partners, art publications, local galleries, and individual collectors.  Also, in addition to the potential new business this will generate, there will be SO many amazing artists there who I greatly admire.  This is the perfect opportunity for me meet and interact with some of my idols.

 

Risks and Challenges

For all the excitement I have for D-Con, I am also very nervous, because there are some challenges I need to overcome.  One of them is entirely on me: I need to produce more artwork.  And I am! (Stay tuned for that)

The largest hurdle at this point, however, is financial... and that's where you can help!  I need the funds to print new merchandise, stickers, and art prints, as well as some branding materials like business cards and banners.  My display design also needs some love.  I have allocated funds from my fundraising goal to go towards the purchase of gridwall panels, display shelves and boxes, and more, to help organize and optimize my space.

But that's not all.  Here is an initial breakdown of my estimated expenses for the convention:

  • $500 - Stickers
  • $750 - 10x10 Booth fee
  • $75 - Transportation and parking
  • $300 - Display supplies (grid wall, display shelves, etc)
  • $300 - Packaging and branding (bags, plastic sleeves, logo banner, etc.)
  • $100 - Frames
  • $1500 - Merch printing
  • $750 - Art prints

 

Total: $4275

 

To keep this much after Indiegogo’s 5% platform fee and 5% reserved funds are set aside, I need a total of $4750.  I am rounding up to $5000 to buffer for unforeseen expenses and inaccurate estimates.

 

In exchange for your contribution to my fundraiser, I am offering several perk options.  These include pre-sale items (merch, stickers, prints), original drawings, and a few custom commissions!

 

Makani Madness!

I am offering the following bundle of pre-sale items at a huge discount:

  • The full 6-pack of stickers
  • Two t-shirts of your choice (one of each design or two of the same design, your choice)
  • One limited edition print of your choice
  • Two random open edition prints

 

There is a SUPER EARLY BIRD tier, an EARLY BIRD tier, and a regular discount tier.  Claim one of these bundles for yourself before they run out!

 

Pre-Sale Items

The first 11 perks listed to the right contain pre-sale items.  Here is a breakdown of what those items are:

 

Original Drawings

For this fundraiser, I have these 11 original drawings for sale at $50 off my normal asking price:

 

Custom Drawings

I am offering a total of 3 custom commissioned drawings.  All drawings will created with mixed media on 9x12 inch paper.  I ask that you allow me to maintain creative control over the piece.  That said, I invite you to provide some seed inspiration for your custom commissioned artwork.  Examples include but are certainly not limited to:

  • A favorite animal
  • An astrology sign
  • A picture of a relative
    • The drawing would be a caricature version of any reference picture you may provide

 

There will be:

  • 2 custom drawings available for delivery by February 2020
  • 1 custom drawing available for delivery by CHRISTMAS!!!

 

If you have any questions about the custom artwork options, please contact me!

 

If you aren't able to contribute financially, that's totally ok!  There's a few other ways to help:

  • Follow me on Instagram and Facebook.
  • Please, SHARE SHARE SHARE this campaign!  The more people know about it the better chance I have at reaching my goal!
  • If you don't want any of the perks and simply want to donate to the cause, my Venmo username is @elimsmith  ;-)

 

DesignerCon takes place from November 22-24, 2019, at the Anaheim Convention Center.  Go to www.designercon.com for more info and to buy tickets.
